billTitle: AN ACT VALIDATING THE DECEMBER 10, 2019, REFERENDUM IN REGIONAL SCHOOL DISTRICT NO. 19.
stmtPurp: To validate the referendum held on December 10, 2019, in Regional School District No. 19.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE REGULATION OF SIGNS BY ZONING COMMISSIONS.
stmtPurp: To authorize municipal zoning commissions to regulate the height, size, location, brightness and illumination of all signs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CONTINUATION OF RETIREMENT ALLOWANCES FOR CERTAIN RETIREES UPON SUBSEQUENT EMPLOYMENT BY A BOARD OF EDUCATION.
stmtPurp: To permit retired public safety personnel to receive retirement allowances, but not credit in to a municipal pension system, if such personnel are employed by a local or regional board of education in a public safety capacity after retirement.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING THE PROPERTY TAX EXEMPTION FOR CERTAIN RESIDENTIAL RENEWABLE ENERGY SOURCES AND NONRESIDENTIAL HYDROPOWER FACILITIES.
stmtPurp: To revise the property tax exemption for certain renewable energy sources and hydropower facilities.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY OF THE OBSTACLES TO MERGING OR CONSOLIDATING MUNICIPAL FIRE DISTRICTS AND FIRE DEPARTMENTS.
stmtPurp: To require the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management to conduct a study regarding the obstacles to merging or consolidating the fire districts or fire departments of two or more municipalities.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE MAXIMUM FINE FOR OPERATING A SNOWMOBILE OR ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLE AT AN UNREASONABLE RATE OF SPEED OR IN A NEGLIGENT MANNER.
stmtPurp: To increase the maximum fine for operating a snow mobile or all-terrain vehicle at an unreasonable rate of speed or in a negligent manner.

billTitle: TO EXEMPT DISABLED VETERANS FROM THE "PASSPORT TO THE PARKS FEE".
stmtPurp: To exempt disabled veterans from the "Passport to the Parks Fee".

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE SALE OF ENERGY DRINKS TO PERSONS UNDER SIXTEEN YEARS OF AGE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the sale of energy drinks to persons younger than sixteen years old.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHILDREN'S SAFETY.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Children and Families to conduct a study to determine whether policy and procedural changes within the Department of Children and Families may increase the safety of children.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHILDREN'S HEALTH.
stmtPurp: To direct the Commissioner of Public Health to conduct a study to determine whether policy and procedural changes within the Department of Public Health may improve the health of children.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR PEDIATRIC AUTOIMMUNE NEUROPSYCHIATRIC DISORDERS ASSOCIATED WITH STREPTOCOCCAL INFECTIONS AND PEDIATRIC ACUTE-ONSET NEUROPSYCHIATRIC SYNDROME.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for pediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorders associated with streptococcal infections and pediatric acute-onset neuropsychiatric syndrome.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ANNUAL REPORTING OF THE NUMBER OF VERIFIED ACTS OF BULLYING IN SCHOOLS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the requirement that each school under the jurisdiction of a local or regional board of education annually report the number of verified acts of bullying in such school to the Department of Education.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A YOUTH SUICIDE PREVENTION PILOT PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Children and Families and the Office of the Child Advocate to establish a youth suicide prevention pilot program.

billTitle: AN ACT ADJUSTING STATE LEGISLATOR SALARIES FOR INFLATION.
stmtPurp: To adjust state legislator salaries for inflation since the current rate was established in 2001.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE FUNDING OF SMOKING PREVENTION EFFORTS.
stmtPurp: To prevent smoking.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING FUNDING FOR TOBACCO PREVENTION AND CESSATION EFFORTS.
stmtPurp: To adjust the state budget by adding twelve million dollars to tobacco prevention and cessation efforts.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FUNDING FOR ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS TO PREVENT THE USE OF VAPOR PRODUCTS BY UNDERAGE PERSONS.
stmtPurp: To prevent the illegal use of vapor products by minors.

billTitle: AN ACT APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR REPAIRS AT THE STONE HOUSE AT HAMILTON PARK IN WATERBURY.
stmtPurp: To fund repairs at the Stone House at Hamilton Park in Waterbury.

billTitle: AN ACT DECREASING LEGISLATIVE POSTAL COSTS.
stmtPurp: To decrease the amount of state funds used for legislators to send mail.

billTitle: AN ACT APPROPRIATING FUNDS FOR A QUALIFIED ABLE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To provide funding for a state-run qualified ABLE program.

billTitle: AN ACT PROVIDING FOR THE RETENTION OF UNCLAIMED BOTTLE DEPOSITS BY DISTRIBUTORS AND REQUIRING AN INCREASE IN THE HANDLING FEE PAID TO REDEMPTION CENTERS.
stmtPurp: To shift unclaimed bottle deposits from the state to beverage distributors and to require distributors to fairly compensate bottle redemption stores for each container they redeem.

billTitle: AN ACT ELIMINATING THE INCREASE IN THE GREENHOUSE GAS REDUCTION FEE.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the recent increase in the greenhouse gas reduction fee.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING HANDICAP RAMPS FOR RESIDENTIAL USE FROM THE SALES AND USE TAXES.
stmtPurp: To exempt handicap ramps for residential use from the sales and use taxes.

billTitle: AN ACT FUNDING THE STATE-WIDE FIREARMS TRAFFICKING TASK FORCE BY REDUCING CITIZENS' ELECTION PROGRAM GRANTS.
stmtPurp: To provide funding to the state-wide firearms trafficking task force and prevent deaths from illegally trafficked firearms.

billTitle: AN ACT FUNDING THE PILOT PROGRAM FOR THE EXPANSION OF ADVANCED MANUFACTURING CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS TO PUBLIC HIGH SCHOOLS.
stmtPurp: To appropriate one million dollars for the pilot program for the expansion of advanced manufacturing certificate programs to public high schools.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TAX CREDIT FOR EMPLOYERS OF INSTRUCTORS IN ADVANCED MANUFACTURING CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS AT REGIONAL COMMUNITY-TECHNICAL COLLEGES.
stmtPurp: To establish a tax credit for employers of instructors in advanced manufacturing certificate programs at regional community-technical colleges.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE PAYMENT OF A REWARD TO PATRICIA "PIDGIE" D'ALLESSIO.
stmtPurp: To recognize and compensate Ms. Patricia "Pidgie" D'Allessio for her role in the identification, arrest and conviction of serial predator Robert Nelson Malm, who sexually assaulted Ms. D'Allessio and sexually assaulted and murdered eleven-year-old Irene Fiederowicz.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE MEMBERS AND DUTIES OF THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION BOARD.
stmtPurp: To (1) increase State Historic Preservation Review Board members' terms from one year to three years; (2) decrease the notice period required for notification of a municipal preservation board or a municipality's chief executive officer that a property is nominated to the National Register of Historic Places from sixty days to thirty days; (3) eliminate the requirement that the State Historic Preservation Officer attend municipal hearings regarding nominations to the National Register of Historic Places; and (4) change the board's name from the State Historic Preservation Board to the State Historic Preservation Review Board.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE ESTABLISHMENT OF THE LEARN HERE, LIVE HERE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to establish the Learn Here, Live Here program to help graduates of any institution of higher education or certain certificate programs of private occupational schools save toward a down payment on their first home in the state by segregating a portion of their state income tax payments for up to ten years after they graduate.

billTitle: AN ACT ELIMINATING CERTAIN INACTIVE ADVISORY GROUPS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the Culture and Tourism Advisory Committee, Commission on Connecticut's Future, Small Business Advisory Board and Committee for the Restoration of Historic Assets in Connecticut.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING BONDS OF THE STATE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE WATERBURY RAIL LINE.
stmtPurp: To authorize bonds of the state to purchase equipment and facilities to increase commuter rail service along the Waterbury Rail Line.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING FUNDING AVAILABLE TO HOMEOWNERS THROUGH THE HEALTHY HOMES FUND.
stmtPurp: To increase grants-in-aid to homeowners in certain areas of New Haven and Woodbridge for repair of structurally damaged homes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PAYMENT IN LIEU OF TAXES.
stmtPurp: To increase the amount of payment in lieu of taxes provided to municipalities and establish a formula by which to calculate adequate reimbursement to municipalities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING STUDIES OF THE EFFECT OF LEGALIZED GAMBLING.
stmtPurp: To require the next study of the effect of legalized gambling by October 1, 2021.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING SPORTS WAGERING IN THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To authorize sports wagering in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING FREE FISHING LICENSES TO VETERANS WHO HAVE BEEN HONORABLY DISCHARGED.
stmtPurp: To allow veterans to fish free of charge.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING SENIOR CITIZENS FROM THE PASSPORT TO THE PARKS MOTOR VEHICLE REGISTRATION FEE.
stmtPurp: To exempt senior citizens from the Passport to the Parks fee.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE RETAIL PERMITS.
stmtPurp: To increase the number of alcoholic beverage retail permits a person or backer may acquire an interest in.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ACCEPTABLE FORMS OF CURRENCY AS PAYMENT IN LOCAL BUSINESSES.
stmtPurp: To prohibit persons who offer consumer goods and services to the public from refusing to accept cash as a form of payment.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MINOR AND TECHNICAL REVISIONS TO THE LIQUOR CONTROL ACT.
stmtPurp: To make minor and technical changes to the Liquor Control Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ANTI-TRUST ISSUES AND THE PALLIATIVE USE OF MARIJUANA.
stmtPurp: To require review by the office of the Attorney General of proposed changes of ownership of medical marijuana businesses licensed by the Department of Consumer Protection.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DIABETES AND HIGH DEDUCTIBLE HEALTH PLANS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Expand required health insurance coverage for prescription drugs, equipment and supplies used to treat diabetes; (2) restrict cost-sharing for such drugs, equipment and supplies; (3) require licensed pharmacists to dispense such drugs, equipment and supplies without a prescription in certain circumstances; (4) require the Commissioner of Social Services to study and report regarding the feasibility of implementing a low-income diabetes assistance fund; and (5) make changes to various provisions of the general statutes concerning high deductible health plans to more closely conform to provisions of the Internal Revenue Code concerning health savings accounts and medical savings accounts.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AUTOMOBILE INSURANCE COVERAGE.
stmtPurp: To (1) require insurers that issue private passenger nonfleet automobile insurance policies in this state to provide coverage for original equipment manufacturer replacement parts in certain circumstances, (2) limit the circumstances in which an insurer may declare a damaged motor vehicle to be a constructive total loss, and (3) expand the Connecticut Unfair Insurance Practices Act to incorporate additional conduct by insurers that issue automobile insurance policies in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING COURT OPERATIONS.
stmtPurp: To make various revisions to statutes governing Judicial Branch processes and procedures.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ADOPTION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CONNECTICUT PARENTAGE ACT.
stmtPurp: To adopt and implement the Connecticut Parentage Act.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY OF THE IMPACT OF PERMITTING RESPONDERS WHO ARE NOT PRIMARY SERVICE AREA RESPONDERS TO RESPOND TO A PRIMARY SERVICE AREA.
stmtPurp: To require a study of the impact of allowing nonprimary service area responders to respond to a primary service area.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PROVISION OF CATERED FOOD AND BEVERAGES IN FUNERAL HOMES.
stmtPurp: To enable funeral directors to offer catered food and beverages to persons attending funeral services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING REMOTE ACCESS TO MEDICAL RECORDS MAINTAINED BY HOSPITALS AND HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS.
stmtPurp: To allow the Department of Public Health to have remote access to electronic medical records of hospitals that involve reportable diseases, emergency illnesses and health conditions or reportable tumors.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY REGARDING ALLOWING FIRST RESPONDERS TO CARRY AND ADMINISTER EPINEPHRINE CARTRIDGE INJECTORS.
stmtPurp: To require a study regarding the feasibility of allowing all first responders to carry and administer epinephrine cartridge injectors.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE FEE FOR A CREMATION PERMIT.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the charging of a fee for a cremation permit for the cremation of a deceased person who was under the age of eighteen.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WATER QUALITY NOTIFICATION.
stmtPurp: To require the owner of a property supplied by a public well or a well for semipublic use to notify each tenant and lessee of such property of the results of certain water quality tests.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TITLE PROTECTION FOR NURSES.
stmtPurp: To require title protection for nurses.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SAFE DRINKING WATER.
stmtPurp: To require (1) water companies to provide drinking water to consumers in the event of a water main break or loss of system pressure; (2) small community water systems to prepare capacity implementation plans; and (3) bottlers to test approved water sources for unregulated contaminants and report such results to the department.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ADDITIONAL GRANTS-IN-AID FOR THE ASSISTANCE OF HOMELESS PERSONS.
stmtPurp: To expand the current program to provide services for persons living in motor vehicles or finding temporary housing with friends or family.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AN EXEMPTION FROM THE FEE FOR ISSUANCE OF A CREMATION CERTIFICATE FOR THE CREMATION OF THE BODY OF A MINOR.
stmtPurp: To exempt the cremation of the body of a minor from the fee for the issuance of the cremation certificate.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ONLINE LOTTERY GAMES IN THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To (1) authorize the Connecticut Lottery Corporation to offer online lottery draw games, digital keno and interactive instant win games, (2) exempt certain records concerning the corporation's voluntary self-exclusion process from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act, and (3) increase the corporation's contribution to the chronic gamblers treatment rehabilitation account.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A COMMISSION ON GAMING.
stmtPurp: To establish a Commission on Gaming and transfer oversight of gambling in this state from the Department of Consumer Protection to the commission.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DISCLOSURE OF INFORMATION BY THE CONNECTICUT AIRPORT AUTHORITY UNDER THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT, SECURITY SERVICES AT BRADLEY INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT AND A STUDY OF STRUCTURES TO BE ERECTED PROXIMATE TO GENERAL AVIATION AIRPORTS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Allow the executive director of the Connecticut Airport Authority to determine whether there are reasonable grounds to believe the disclosure of records concerning the security infrastructure at Connecticut Airport Authority airports may result in a safety risk, (2) require the Connecticut Airport Authority and the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection to enter into a contract for security services at Bradley International Airport, and (3) repeal a requirement for the Connecticut Airport Authority to study certain safety hazards.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RECOMMENDATIONS BY THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES.
stmtPurp: To implement the recommendations of the Department of Motor Vehicles.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE NONCONSENSUAL TOWING OR TRANSPORTING OF MOTOR VEHICLES.
stmtPurp: To permit a wrecker to assess a surcharge of ten dollars for the nonconsensual towing or transporting of a motor vehicle.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ROADWAYS.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Transportation to study issues relating to roadways in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TRANSPORTATION OF PASSENGERS BY CERTAIN SIXTEEN AND SEVENTEEN-YEAR-OLD DRIVERS.
stmtPurp: To allow certain sixteen and seventeen-year-old drivers to transport certain passengers.

billTitle: AN ACT REVISING A TRANSPORTATION STATUTE.
stmtPurp: To make a technical change to a transportation statute.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SLOWING DOWN FOR GARBAGE TRUCKS, RECYCLING TRUCKS AND OIL AND TANK VEHICLES.
stmtPurp: To require motor vehicle operators to slow down when passing a garbage truck, recycling truck or tank vehicle.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MAINTENANCE WORK ZONE SAFETY ENFORCEMENT.
stmtPurp: To allow the use of automated traffic enforcement safety devices within maintenance work zones.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PROBATION PERIODS FOLLOWING CONVICTION FOR CERTAIN SEXUAL MISCONDUCT CRIMES AGAINST MINORS.
stmtPurp: To authorize extended periods of probation following conviction for certain crimes against minors.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NURSING HOME SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To study the sufficiency of nursing home services in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PREVENTION OF HEATSTROKE-RELATED DEATHS IN MOTOR VEHICLES.
stmtPurp: To require (1) the Office of Early Childhood to develop a document that provides tips on preventing heatstroke-related deaths in motor vehicles, and (2) operators of child care centers, group child care homes and family child care homes to post copies of such document on the premises of such centers and homes and distribute such document to parents and guardians.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INCLUSION OF SHADED AREAS AT NEW MUNICIPAL PLAYGROUNDS.
stmtPurp: To require a shaded area at each new municipal playground.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PROPERTY TAX DEFERRAL FOR ELDERLY PERSONS.
stmtPurp: To help alleviate financial burdens on elderly homeowners by permitting municipalities to defer property taxes for those who qualify for such tax deferrals.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TRANSPORTATION FOR NONAMBULATORY NURSING HOME RESIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To increase the opportunity for nonambulatory residents of nursing homes to visit the homes of family members.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF MEDICAID-FUNDED PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To study the efficacy of Medicaid-funded programs in serving senior citizens and others.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RENTERS' REBATE PROGRAM FOR SENIOR CITIZENS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.
stmtPurp: To remove impediments to timely financial relief for senior citizens and persons with disabilities.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING SENIOR CITIZENS FROM THE "PASSPORT TO THE PARKS FEE".
stmtPurp: To exempt senior citizens age sixty-five and older from the "Passport to the Parks Fee".

billTitle: AN ACT DETERRING ABUSE IN NURSING HOMES.
stmtPurp: To allow nursing home residents or their representatives to install electronic monitoring devices in their rooms, provided any roommates agree in writing to the use of such devices and liability for any breach of privacy related to the resident's use of such device is waived for nursing homes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ADOPTION OF THE UNIFORM REAL PROPERTY TRANSFER ON DEATH ACT.
stmtPurp: To allow senior citizens and others to transfer real property at death to avert costly, time-consuming probate proceedings.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NONCOMPETE AGREEMENTS IN THE BLOCKCHAIN TECHNOLOGY INDUSTRY.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the use of noncompete agreements in the blockchain technology industry.

billTitle: AN ACT IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE WORKING GROUP ON A PUBLIC-PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP TO RECRUIT BUSINESSES TO CONNECTICUT.
stmtPurp: To implement the recommendations of the working group on a public-private partnership to recruit businesses to the state.

billTitle: AN ACT EXTENDING THE MANUFACTURING APPRENTICESHIP TAX CREDIT TO PASS-THROUGH ENTITIES.
stmtPurp: To allow certain business entities to claim the manufacturing apprenticeship tax credit against the personal income tax.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CREATION OF A PILOT PROGRAM FOR AN EARLY CHILDHOOD BUSINESS INCUBATOR MODEL.
stmtPurp: To establish a pilot program that authorizes the Commissioner of Early Childhood to issue a license to a person or group of persons to operate a family child care home in a space that is not a private home and that has been provided by an association, organization, corporation, institution or agency.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PROVISION OF SPECIAL EDUCATION AT TECHNICAL EDUCATION AND CAREER SCHOOLS.
stmtPurp: To repeal the provision permitting the referral of a special education student enrolled in a technical education and career school to the school district in which such student resides.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INCLUSION OF CLIMATE CHANGE INSTRUCTION IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOL CURRICULUM.
stmtPurp: To include climate change instruction in the public school curriculum of the state.

billTitle: AN ACT ELIMINATING THE LICENSURE EXEMPTION FOR CERTAIN ORGANIZATIONS PROVIDING CHILD CARE SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To remove the licensure exemption for certain organizations that provide child care services.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A WORKING GROUP TO STUDY ISSUES RELATING TO SCHOOL START TIMES.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Education to establish a working group to study issues relating to school start times.

billTitle: AN ACT IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE OFFICE OF EARLY CHILDHOOD.
stmtPurp: To implement the recommendations of the Office of Early Childhood.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING YOUTH CAMPS.
stmtPurp: To require licensed youth camp employees who are eighteen years of age or older to submit to a comprehensive background check.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING ELIGIBILITY IN THE CARE4KIDS PROGRAM TO PARENTS PARTICIPATING IN AN EVEN START PROGRAM OR ENROLLED IN CERTAIN SECONDARY EDUCATION PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To expand eligibility in the Care4Kids program to parents who are participating in a local Even Start program or enrolled in certain secondary education programs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PUBLIC EDUCATION IN CONNECTICUT.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Education to conduct a study of public education in Connecticut.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING ELIGIBILITY IN THE CARE4KIDS PROGRAM FOR HOMELESS FAMILIES.
stmtPurp: To expand eligibility in the Care4Kids program to include homeless families.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING VOLTAGE STANDARDS.
stmtPurp: To require electric distribution companies to comply with the most current voltage variation standards of the American National Standards Institute when rendering service to commercial or residential properties, unless otherwise granted an exemption.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE STUDY OF THE USE OF TECHNOLOGY IN THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to conduct a study to determine whether policy and procedural changes within the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection may increase the effectiveness of the use of technology in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CONSUMER PROTECTIONS FOR CUSTOMERS OF ELECTRIC SUPPLIERS.
stmtPurp: To (1) define "telesales call", "record" and "recording", (2) add requirements for electric suppliers regarding telesales calls and face-to-face marketing, to (3) permit the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to order fines, restitution to customers or a combination of fines and restitution, and (4) prohibit the assignment or transfer of customers without prior approval of the authority.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ELECTRIC VEHICLE CHARGING STATIONS.
stmtPurp: To (1) make void and unenforceable any covenant, restriction or condition in any deed, contract, security instrument or other instrument affecting the transfer or sale of property which prohibits or unreasonably restricts the installation or use of an electric vehicle charging station, (2) establish conditions to which a unit owner must agree in order to obtain approval for installation of an electric vehicle charging station, and (3) permit tenants to request installation of electric vehicle charging stations, subject to compliance with a landlord's requirements.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DISTRIBUTED ENERGY RESOURCES SYSTEM IMPROVEMENTS.
stmtPurp: To authorize the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection and the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to perform joint or concurrent evaluations of grid-side system enhancement proposals, and to provide the department authority to procure renewable natural gas from anaerobic digestion facilities for injection into the natural gas distribution system.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE COMMERCIAL PROPERTY ASSESSED CLEAN ENERGY PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To expand the definition of energy improvements to include zero-emission vehicle refueling infrastructure and resiliency measures and to exempt these expansions from the savings-to-investments ratio and to permit direct assignment of liens to third-party capital providers.

billTitle: AN ACT ELIMINATING THE QUALIFYING INCOME THRESHOLDS FOR THE SOCIAL SECURITY BENEFITS DEDUCTION UNDER THE PERSONAL INCOME TAX.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the qualifying income thresholds for the Social Security benefits deduction under the personal income tax.

billTitle: AN ACT ELIMINATING THE ESTATE AND GIFT TAXES.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the estate and gift taxes.

billTitle: AN ACT EXCLUDING COIN-OPERATED CAR WASHES FROM THE SALES TAX.
stmtPurp: To exclude coin-operated car washes from the sales tax.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A MINIMUM BASE RATE FOR METHADONE MAINTENANCE TREATMENT.
stmtPurp: To eliminate requirements that payment rates be tied to performance measures.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PAYMENTS TO PROVIDERS OF SOCIAL SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To ensure adequate payment to providers of social services to ensure access to quality care and integrate peer support services for behavioral health into the Medicaid program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDER ADVISORY COUNCIL.
stmtPurp: To add persons with autism spectrum disorder or their parents as chairpersons of the Autism Spectrum Disorder Advisory Council.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NURSING FACILITY REIMBURSEMENT.
stmtPurp: To implement an acuity-based payment reimbursement system under the medical assistance program for nursing facilities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TRANSITION TO A MEDICAID NURSING HOME FACILITY CASE MIX PAYMENT SYSTEM.
stmtPurp: To ensure the transition to a new Medicaid payment system for nursing home facilities is equitable, efficient and adequately funded.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To make a technical change to a provision concerning the Department of Housing.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PROPERTY TAX ABATEMENT FOR FIRST-TIME HOMEOWNERS WHO OBTAIN A LOAN FROM THE CONNECTICUT HOUSING FINANCE AUTHORITY.
stmtPurp: To authorize municipalities to abate up to five hundred dollars per assessment year of property taxes for certain first-time homebuyers obtaining a loan from the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PAYMENTS IN LIEU OF TAXES FOR STATE HOUSING AUTHORITY PROPERTIES.
stmtPurp: To provide municipalities with payment in lieu of taxes for state housing authority properties.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REQUIREMENTS FOR NEW CONSTRUCTION OF AFFORDABLE HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To require new construction of affordable housing developments to comply with additional accessibility, lighting and renewable energy requirements.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CERTIFICATES OF OCCUPANCY FOR RENTAL PROPERTIES.
stmtPurp: To improve enforcement of code requirements in rental properties by restoring the prohibition on rent collection without a certificate of occupancy.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RISK OF HOMELESSNESS FOR THOSE RELEASED FROM THE CUSTODY OF THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Correction to assess the risk of homelessness for incarcerated persons released from its custody and to create a program to address such homelessness and to require additional reports to measure the extent of such homelessness.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING BONDS OF BOARD MEMBERS AND OTHER EMPLOYEES OF THE CONNECTICUT HOUSING FINANCE AUTHORITY.
stmtPurp: To permit the board members and other employees of the Connecticut Housing Finance Authority to obtain an equivalent insurance product in lieu of a surety bond.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ADDITIONAL HOUSING PROTECTIONS FOR A VICTIM OF FAMILY VIOLENCE OR SEXUAL ASSAULT.
stmtPurp: To allow a person who has a valid order of protection to request that such person's landlord change the locks to the person's dwelling unit.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE PERMISSIBLE AMOUNT OF SECURITY DEPOSIT A LANDLORD MAY CHARGE.
stmtPurp: To permit a landlord to require a tenant pay a security deposit of up to three months' rent.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF FAIR SHARE HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Housing to study the New Jersey Fair Housing Act to determine the feasibility of implementing provisions of said act in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EXPLANATIONS OF BENEFITS.
stmtPurp: To require health insurers that deliver, issue for delivery, renew, amend or continue certain health insurance policies in this state to issue explanations of benefits to consumers in certain circumstances, disclose information concerning explanations of benefits to consumers, and require that explanations of benefits be maintained as confidential in certain circumstances.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR PEER SUPPORT SERVICES IN THIS STATE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study health insurance coverage for peer support services in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DENTAL INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR CHILDREN, STEPCHILDREN AND OTHER DEPENDENT CHILDREN.
stmtPurp: To allow children, stepchildren and other dependent children to retain dental insurance coverage under their parents' insurance policies until they attain the age of twenty-six or obtain substitute coverage through an employer.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING REQUIREMENTS FOR PRESCRIBING CLINICALLY INAPPROPRIATE QUANTITIES OF OUTPATIENT PSYCHOTROPIC DRUGS.
stmtPurp: To prohibit health insurance policies providing coverage for outpatient prescription drugs, and mental health care benefits provided under state law, with state funds or to state employees, from requiring a prescribing health care provider to prescribe an outpatient psychotropic drug in a quantity that such provider deems clinically inappropriate.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR UNDOCUMENTED IMMIGRANTS IN THIS STATE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study health insurance coverage for undocumented immigrants in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING CERTAIN VEHICLE STORAGE AGREEMENTS AS A PRECONDITION TO VEHICLE TOWING.
stmtPurp: To prohibit a wrecker from requiring a vehicle owner to contract for more than twenty-four hours of vehicle storage as a precondition to towing the owner's vehicle.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DENTAL AND VISION INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR CHILDREN, STEPCHILDREN AND OTHER DEPENDENT CHILDREN.
stmtPurp: To allow children, stepchildren and other dependent children to retain dental and vision insurance coverage under their parents' insurance policies until they attain the age of twenty-six or obtain substitute coverage through an employer.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR MEDICATION-ASSISTED TREATMENT FOR OPIOID USE DISORDER.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for medication-assisted treatment for opioid use disorder.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LIVING ORGAN DONOR INSURANCE DISCRIMINATION.
stmtPurp: To (1) prohibit certain insurers from discriminating against any individual solely because such individual is a living organ donor, and (2) provide that such discrimination constitutes a violation of the Connecticut Unfair Insurance Practices Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REQUIRED HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR DETOXIFICATION AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To modify required health insurance coverage for detoxification and substance abuse services.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR PRESCRIPTION EYEGLASSES FOR COVERED DEPENDENT CHILDREN WHO ARE YOUNGER THAN NINETEEN YEARS OF AGE.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for (1) at least one pair of prescription eyeglasses during each policy year for each covered dependent child who is younger than nineteen years of age, and (2) not more than one additional pair of prescription eyeglasses for such child during such policy year if the pair of covered prescription eyeglasses that such child previously received during such policy year is lost during such policy year.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE UNIFORM COMMERCIAL REAL ESTATE RECEIVERSHIP ACT.
stmtPurp: To adopt the Uniform Commercial Real Estate Receivership Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' RECOMMENDATIONS FOR TECHNICAL REVISIONS TO THE GOVERNMENT ADMINISTRATION AND ELECTIONS STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make technical revisions to the statutes concerning government administration and elections.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DEALERSHIP FRANCHISES.
stmtPurp: To create a task force to recommend legislation concerning agreements between motor vehicle manufacturers or distributors and motor vehicle dealers.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING ENGINEERS AT THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION TO INSPECT CERTAIN CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS.
stmtPurp: To require engineers employed by the Department of Transportation on a full-time basis to inspect highway and bridge construction projects.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SPECIAL REGISTRATION MARKER PLATES FOR VETERANS WHO SERVED IN PERIODS OF WAR.
stmtPurp: To create special registration marker plates available to veterans who served during certain periods of war.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A SERVICE RIBBON FOR MEMBERS OF THE ARMED FORCES PROVIDING HONOR GUARD DETAIL.
stmtPurp: To authorize the Adjutant General to issue a service ribbon to each member of the armed forces providing honor guard detail at funerals of veterans.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ANNUAL REPORT OF BENEFITS TO VETERANS.
stmtPurp: To extend the deadline for the Commissioner of Veterans Affairs to compile data and submit the report of benefits to veterans to the Military Department and the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to military and veterans' affairs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ORGANIZATION OF THE CONNECTICUT STATE GUARD.
stmtPurp: To allow the Governor to raise, organize, maintain and govern the Connecticut State Guard.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A GREEN ALERT SYSTEM FOR MISSING VETERANS.
stmtPurp: To establish a Green Alert system for missing veterans.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A VETERANS' CEMETERY ACCOUNT.
stmtPurp: To establish a veterans' cemetery account.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WORKERS' COMPENSATION.
stmtPurp: To require the Workers' Compensation Commission to adopt regulations regarding the fair compensation of injured workers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WORKING CONDITIONS.
stmtPurp: To require the Labor Commissioner to adopt regulations regarding fair and safe working conditions.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RIGHT OF A PUBLIC EMPLOYEE TO JOIN OR SUPPORT A UNION.
stmtPurp: To protect the rights of public employees to join or support unions.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING BREASTFEEDING IN THE WORKPLACE.
stmtPurp: To specify certain parameters for a room or other location in the workplace that accommodates employee breastfeeding.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF STUDENT INTERNS AND STUDENT TEACHERS IN COLLEGE ENVIRONMENTS.
stmtPurp: To require the Labor Commissioner to conduct a study regarding student interns and student teachers in college environments.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CALL CENTERS AND NOTICE OF CLOSURES.
stmtPurp: To discourage employers from closing call centers in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT STRENGTHENING THE PROBATE COURT SYSTEM.
stmtPurp: To allow Probate Court employees to be recognized as state employees for the purpose of collective bargaining.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A FAIR WORK WEEK SCHEDULE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the practice of on-call shift scheduling.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DOMESTIC WORKERS.
stmtPurp: To expand the application of various labor laws to domestic workers.

billTitle: AN ACT DECREASING FEES FOR COPYING PUBLIC RECORDS UNDER THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT.
stmtPurp: To reduce the fees paid by the public for copies of public records.

billTitle: AN ACT REVISING CERTAIN ABSENTEE VOTING STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To revise certain absentee voting statutes to no longer require that an elector be absent from his or her town of voting residence during all the hours of voting at a primary, election or referendum.

billTitle: AN ACT REDEFINING PUBLIC OFFICIAL UNDER THE STATE CODES OF ETHICS.
stmtPurp: To redefine "public official" for purposes of the state codes of ethics to include individuals appointed by any state-wide elected officer and to exclude certain individuals appointed by a judge.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ADMINISTRATIVE CHANGES TO ELECTIONS.
stmtPurp: To (1) permit candidates or their agents to amend certain election-related filings to correct errors or omissions without penalty if done so within specified time frames, (2) bring certain state laws relating to the circulation of nominating and primary petitions into compliance with federal case law, (3) in the case of nominations for judges of probate and members of Congress, reduce the time by which a person other than a party-endorsed candidate can file a candidacy for nomination in order for a primary to be held, and (4) require that certain disputes concerning elections or primaries be adjudicated by the superior court for the judicial district of Hartford.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING UNCLAIMED PROPERTY.
stmtPurp: To require additional public notice of abandoned property that has been transferred to the Treasurer, to require the Treasurer to give notice to municipalities which have property that has escheated to the state and to authorize the Treasurer to accept electronic claim forms.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING POLLING PLACE CHALLENGERS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate registrar-appointed challengers from who may be present in the polling place during a primary or election.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MUNICIPAL ETHICS.
stmtPurp: To require every municipality to adopt a code of ethics and the Office of State Ethics to develop a model municipal code of ethics for municipalities to adopt.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SERVICE OF PROCESS FEES.
stmtPurp: To prohibit state marshals from negotiating fees different from those set in statute.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING FOR PARAMEDICS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the requirement that applicants for a license as a paramedic complete mental health first aid training.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LEAVE OF LEVEL TWO OR NONESSENTIAL STATE EMPLOYEES ASSISTING IN A CIVIL PREPAREDNESS EMERGENCY.
stmtPurp: To permit level two or nonessential state employees who volunteer with a local organization for civil preparedness to assist in a civil preparedness emergency or local civil preparedness emergency without loss of pay, vacation time, sick leave or earned overtime accumulation.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING EXERTIONAL HEAT ILLNESS EDUCATION TRAINING FOR COACHES.
stmtPurp: To require exertional heat illness training for coaches.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PERFLUOROALKYL AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES.
stmtPurp: To limit the public's exposure to perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY OF STAFFING LEVELS FOR NURSE'S AIDES IN NURSING HOMES.
stmtPurp: To require a study of the staffing levels for nurse's aides in nursing homes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING INTERSEX PERSONS.
stmtPurp: To address the needs of the intersex community who have suffered from discrimination and inaccurate documentation of their sex by providing relief from such issues.

billTitle: AN ACT LIMITING THE USE OF PERFLUOROALKYL AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES AND EXPANDED POLYSTYRENE IN FOOD PACKAGING.
stmtPurp: To limit the use of perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances and expanded polystyrene in food packaging.

billTitle: AN ACT REDUCING THE MANUFACTURER'S LICENSE FEE FOR CAMP TRAILERS.
stmtPurp: To reduce the manufacturer's license fee for camp trailers to one hundred dollars.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MUNICIPALITIES AND THE SALE OF ALCOHOLIC LIQUOR.
stmtPurp: To streamline the municipal voting process regarding the sale of alcoholic liquor.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AUTO GLASS EMERGENCY TEMPORARY TECHNICIANS.
stmtPurp: To establish an auto glass temporary license to allow auto glass companies doing business in the state to perform auto glass work in the event of a state disaster or emergency.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO MEDICAL MARIJUANA STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make various revisions to the medical marijuana program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CASH REFUNDS FOR THE BALANCE OF A GIFT CARD.
stmtPurp: To increase the minimum balance amount for which a consumer using a gift card may request a cash refund.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TOBACCO BARS.
stmtPurp: To allow for the expansion, change in location and establishment of tobacco bars.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION TRANSPARENCY.
stmtPurp: To require charitable organizations to disclose their registration numbers and certain financial information when soliciting funds.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE MOTOR VEHICLE MILL RATE AND MOTOR VEHICLES REGISTERED OUT OF STATE.
stmtPurp: To permit municipalities to establish a mill rate for certain motor vehicles that are not registered in this state but that are statutorily subject to property tax in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A MORATORIUM ON THE INSTALLATION OF RECYCLED TIRE RUBBER AT MUNICIPAL AND PUBLIC SCHOOL PLAYGROUNDS.
stmtPurp: To establish a moratorium on the installation of crumb rubber ground covers at municipal and public school playgrounds.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE REMITTANCE OF SUPPLEMENTAL GRANT AWARDS TO LOCAL VOLUNTEER FIRE COMPANIES.
stmtPurp: To require the State Fire Administrator to remit one hundred dollars or an equivalent amount in credits to a volunteer fire company that provides an emergency response service on certain highways.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ABANDONED AND BLIGHTED PROPERTY RECEIVERSHIP.
stmtPurp: To remove the municipal population threshold for certain parties to petition the Superior Court for appointment of a receiver for a blighted and abandoned property.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TRAINING FOR CERTAIN PLANNING AND ZONING OFFICIALS.
stmtPurp: To allow municipalities to require training for members of planning commissions, zoning commissions, combined planning and zoning commissions and zoning boards of appeals.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING BOARD OF EDUCATION VACANCIES.
stmtPurp: To (1) specify that, for any vacancy on a local board of education that has not been filled within thirty days of its occurrence, only the remaining members of such board can fill such vacancy, and (2) require the individual selected by such remaining members to take the oath of office within sixty days after being so selected in order to fill such vacancy.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF AGING AND DISABILITY SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To amend or repeal statutes concerning the Department of Aging and Disability Services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TEMPORARY STATE SERVICES FOR VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE.
stmtPurp: To expedite nutritional assistance, child care benefits and cash assistance for victims of domestic violence.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES' PAYMENT SUSPENSIONS.
stmtPurp: To give providers of social services due process protections before payment is suspended by the Department of Social Services.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES TO WORK WITH THE UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE TO EXPLORE CERTAIN SUPPLEMENTAL NUTRITION ASSISTANCE OPTIONS.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Social Services to explore options for providing supplemental nutrition assistance benefits.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MEDICAID AUDITS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate extrapolation of provider clerical errors in Medicaid audits and limit recovery by the state against such providers to any resulting overpayment and state administrative expenses related to investigation of the clerical error.

billTitle: AN ACT ELIMINATING STATE RECOVERY OF PUBLIC ASSISTANCE EXCEPT AS REQUIRED UNDER FEDERAL LAW.
stmtPurp: To eliminate recovery of public assistance payments from beneficiaries except as required under federal law.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A BILL OF RIGHTS FOR POST-SECONDARY STUDENTS WITH AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDER.
stmtPurp: To ensure students with autism spectrum disorder have the necessary support to achieve success at state institutions of higher education.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WARRANTIES APPLICABLE TO POLICE, FIRE AND OTHER MUNICIPAL VEHICLES.
stmtPurp: To expand the automobile lemon law to cover municipal vehicles.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING POLICE REPORTS OF MOTOR VEHICLE ACCIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate a requirement that a police officer, in the officer's report of a motor vehicle accident involving a death, reach a conclusion as to the cause of the accident or refer the case to the appropriate state's attorney.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING BEST PRACTICES FOR WELLNESS CHECKS BY POLICE OFFICERS.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection to identify best practices for police officers to follow when conducting wellness checks and distribute a report of such best practices to local police departments.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING STREET RACING.
stmtPurp: To subject motor vehicle operators engaging in demonstrations of speed or skill on public highways to the same penalties as street racing.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING FINES FOR OPERATING SNOWMOBILES, ALL-TERRAIN VEHICLES, DIRT BIKES AND MINI-MOTORCYCLES IN VIOLATION OF A MUNICIPAL ORDINANCE.
stmtPurp: To increase the maximum fines for operating a snowmobile, all-terrain vehicle, dirt bike or mini-motorcycle in violation of a municipal ordinance.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PURCHASE OF OPIOID ANTAGONIST AND CARTRIDGE INJECTOR PRODUCTS FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT USE.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Administrative Services, in conjunction with the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection, to enter cooperative purchasing plans with municipalities to provide opioid antagonist and cartridge injector products for use by police officers in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY OF TECHNOLOGY THAT POLICE OFFICERS, FIREFIGHTERS AND EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES PERSONNEL MAY USE WHEN RESPONDING TO OPIOID OVERDOSES.
stmtPurp: To require a study of technology that police officers, firefighters and emergency medical services personnel may use when responding to opioid overdoses.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING VOLUNTEER FIRE COMPANIES AND DEPARTMENTS AND VOLUNTEER AMBULANCE SERVICES AND COMPANIES FROM THE FEE FOR A CRIMINAL HISTORY RECORDS CHECK.
stmtPurp: To exempt volunteer fire companies and departments and volunteer ambulance services and companies from the fee for a criminal history records check.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING OPERATION OF THE LOTTERY BY THE DEPARTMENT OF CONSUMER PROTECTION.
stmtPurp: To terminate the Connecticut Lottery Corporation and transfer responsibility for operating the lottery to the Department of Consumer Protection.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE ON PUBLIC SAFETY ANSWERING POINT CONSOLIDATION.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study and make recommendations on public safety answering point consolidation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RELIABILITY OF 9-1-1 CALL SERVICE.
stmtPurp: To ensure continuous and uninterrupted 9-1-1 call service to public safety answering points.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION TO DEVELOP A TRANSPORTATION INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT PLAN.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Transportation, in consultation with the Office of Policy and Management, to develop a transportation infrastructure investment plan.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PEDESTRIAN SAFETY AT CROSSWALKS, SPEED LIMITS IN MUNICIPALITIES, FINES AND CHARGES FOR CERTAIN VIOLATIONS AND THE GREENWAYS COMMEMORATIVE ACCOUNT.
stmtPurp: To (1) require motorists to grant the right-of-way to pedestrians who affirmatively indicate their intention to cross the road in a crosswalk; (2) allow local traffic authorities to establish lower speed limits on streets under their jurisdiction by holding a public hearing regarding such speed limits and providing notification of such speed limits to the Office of the State Traffic Administration; (3) increase the fine for operating a motor vehicle while using a hand-held mobile telephone or electronic device; (4) increase the additional fee provided to municipalities for certain traffic violations; (5) establish a fine for opening the door of a motor vehicle in a way that impedes the travel of a pedestrian or a person riding a bicycle; and (6) establish the greenways commemorative account.

billTitle: AN ACT ADOPTING THE REVISED UNIFORM LAW ON NOTARIAL ACTS.
stmtPurp: To adopt the Revised Uniform Law on Notarial Acts.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NONSOLICITATION AGREEMENTS IN THE HOME HEALTH SERVICES INDUSTRY.
stmtPurp: To allow nonsolicitation agreements in the home health services industry.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDENT LOAN REIMBURSEMENT PROGRAM FOR CERTAIN PRIVATE SECTOR EMPLOYEES IN CERTAIN HIGH-DEMAND FIELDS.
stmtPurp: To examine the creation of a student loan reimbursement program through public-private partnerships to attract skilled labor to the state and meet the hiring needs of private sector employers in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ROLE OF BIRTH-TO-THREE SERVICE PROVIDERS AT PLANNING AND PLACEMENT TEAM MEETINGS.
stmtPurp: To (1) allow parents at planning and placement team meetings to request the attendance and participation of their child's birth-to-three service coordinator and that the recommendations of such child's birth-to-three service provider be addressed, and (2) protect birth-to-three service providers from discipline for making recommendations for special education services at planning and placement team meetings.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES TO SUBMIT A REPORT CONCERNING IMPLEMENTATION OF CERTAIN PROCESSES.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Children and Families to submit a progress report concerning the implementation of the processes developed by the department to collect and provide certain information.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EARLY CHILDHOOD IMMUNIZATION DATA.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Public Health to distribute an immunization survey to each child care center, group child care home and family child care home, determine as to each child care center whether herd immunity exists with respect to certain infectious diseases and publish such determinations on the department's Internet web site.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A SURVEY OF COURT-INVOLVED YOUTHS.
stmtPurp: To require the Court Support Services Division of the Judicial Branch to conduct a survey of youths who interface with the court system or receive services through the Judicial Branch in order to ascertain the need for additional or improved services for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer youths.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY OF THE TIMELINESS OF REPORTS AND FAILURE TO REPORT BY MANDATED REPORTERS.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Children and Families to conduct a study of the timeliness of reports and failure to report by mandated reporters.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CENTERS FOR DISEASE CONTROL AND PREVENTION YOUTH RISK BEHAVIOR SURVEY.
stmtPurp: To require (1) the Department of Public Health to administer the national Youth Risk Behavior Survey, (2) high schools to participate in the survey, if selected, and (3) the Child Advocate to develop questions assessing the risk to youths of being victims of sexual assault or misconduct by an adult.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ONLINE SALE AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC NICOTINE DELIVERY SYSTEMS AND VAPOR PRODUCTS.
stmtPurp: To require online sellers of electronic nicotine delivery systems and vapor products to require purchasers of such systems and products to (1) provide identification at the time of purchase, and (2) ensure that the name on such identification matches the name on the method of payment used to make the purchase.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE PROVISION OF INFORMATION CONCERNING CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Children and Families to develop and operators of youth athletic activities to distribute information concerning appropriate interactions with children and child sexual abuse to youth coaches, participants in youth athletic activities and parents or guardians of such participants.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING BACKGROUND CHECKS FOR CERTAIN EMPLOYEES OF LICENSED YOUTH CAMPS.
stmtPurp: To require licensed youth camp employees who are eighteen years of age or older to submit to a comprehensive background check.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PROCESSING OF RABBITS FOR CONSUMPTION.
stmtPurp: To provide a means for the processing of rabbits in the state for consumption by consumers and retail food establishments.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE SALE OF ANIMAL FIGHTING PARAPHERNALIA.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the sale of items that are used for animal fighting.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE RELEASE OF HELIUM BALLOONS INTO THE ATMOSPHERE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the knowing release of helium balloons into the atmosphere.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE MODERNIZATION OF THE CONNECTICUT BOTTLE REDEMPTION PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To modernize the functioning of the Connecticut Bottle Bill by expanding its coverage and increasing certain fees paid pursuant to the bottle redemption program.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE SALE AND BREEDING OF CERTAIN CETACEANS.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the sale and breeding of certain cetaceans.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MULTI-STREAM RECYCLING.
stmtPurp: To provide for multi-stream recycling in order to establish marketable streams for recycled materials and lessen the effects of such materials on the state's solid waste stream.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING LOCAL REPRESENTATION ON THE CONNECTICUT SITING COUNCIL FOR CERTAIN PROJECTS.
stmtPurp: To allow for local representation on the Siting Council for certain proceedings involving electric distribution companies.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING OFF-SHORE DRILLING FOR OIL AND GAS IN CONNECTICUT.
stmtPurp: To prohibit off-shore drilling for oil and gas and the mapping for such oil in the coastal waters of the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING STATE REVIEW OF FARMLAND PRESERVATION TRANSACTIONS.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the State Property Review Board's review of Farmland Preservation Program transactions in order to expedite their occurrence.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RESIDENTIAL SEWER USE CHARGES DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS.
stmtPurp: To set the charges for a residential user's connection with and use of a sewerage system during the summer months at an amount based upon the average volume of water discharged to the sewerage system during the nonsummer months.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A VOLUMETRIC SURCHARGE STUDY BY THE DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT.
stmtPurp: To require a study on current nonbypassable surcharges or combined public benefit charges, and the impact such charges have on large commercial and industrial customers and small commercial and industrial customers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE STUDY OF COMMUNITY CHOICE AGGREGATION.
stmtPurp: To require a study of community choice aggregation programs by the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE OWNERSHIP OF CERTAIN SOLAR ENERGY PROJECTS BY ELECTRIC DISTRIBUTION COMPANIES.
stmtPurp: To allow electric distribution companies to submit proposals to the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to own solar power generation facilities up to an aggregate of fifty megawatts.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE.
stmtPurp: To (1) allow the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to solicit proposals for the supply of biogas for injection into the natural gas distribution system in the state, (2) require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to reopen or initiate dockets for the sole purpose of evaluating whether a gas company should accelerate its existing schedule for the repair and replacement of aging infrastructure, (3) allow the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to set rates to protect the interests of ratepayers and ensure revenue recovery for gas companies, and (4) require construction contractors to pay not less than the prevailing rate of wage to individuals who perform construction activities with respect to the replacement of a gas company's natural gas distribution infrastructure.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CERTAIN PROGRAMS AND TO INCENTIVIZE AND IMPLEMENT ELECTRIC ENERGY STORAGE RESOURCES.
stmtPurp: To (1) state the policy of the state to encourage the deployment of one thousand megawatts of electric energy storage by December 31, 2030, (2) initiate a program and associated funding for electric energy storage resources connected to the electric distribution system, and (3) permit the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to solicit proposals for demonstration projects that are collocated with electric energy storage derived from Class I renewable energy sources.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CLIMATE ADAPTATION STRATEGIES AT PUBLIC INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION.
stmtPurp: To require public institutions of higher education to develop and implement strategies to reduce greenhouse gas emissions on their campuses by forty-five per cent by the January 1, 2030.

billTitle: AN ACT FUNDING THE DEBT-FREE COMMUNITY COLLEGE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To appropriate sixteen million dollars to the debt-free community college program and to establish an account for such program into which will be deposited state appropriations and any moneys received from any online offering of lottery draw games.

billTitle: AN ACT ALLOWING A PERSONAL INCOME TAX DEDUCTION OR AN ESTATE TAX CREDIT FOR A SCHOLARSHIP DONATION.
stmtPurp: To allow either a personal income tax deduction or an estate tax credit for a donation to an endowment fund established by the Connecticut Higher Education Supplemental Loan Authority for the benefit of the Roberta B. Willis Scholarship program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FREEDOM OF EXPRESSION ON COLLEGE CAMPUSES.
stmtPurp: To require institutions of higher education in the state to adopt a policy on freedom of expression.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EARLY COLLEGE HIGH SCHOOL PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study the feasibility of establishing a pathways in technology early college high school program in alliance districts which would enroll students from surrounding towns.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE INSURANCE COMMISSIONER TO STUDY THE FEASIBILITY AND LIKELY EFFECTS OF MANDATING COVERAGE FOR CERTAIN BENEFITS UNDER MEDICARE SUPPLEMENT INSURANCE POLICIES AND CERTIFICATES.
stmtPurp: To require the Insurance Commissioner to study the feasibility and likely effects of mandating coverage for certain benefits under Medicare supplement insurance policies and certificates.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY PROPERTY AND CASUALTY INSURANCE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study property and casualty insurance.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY HEALTH INSURANCE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study health insurance.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE REGULATION AND TAXATION OF TRAVEL INSURANCE AND ASSOCIATED ENTITIES, PRODUCTS AND PROFESSIONALS.
stmtPurp: To provide for the regulation and taxation of travel insurance, and associated entities, products and professionals, in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT LIMITING CHANGES TO PRESCRIPTION DRUG FORMULARIES AND LISTS OF COVERED DRUGS.
stmtPurp: To limit the circumstances in which a health carrier may remove a prescription drug from a drug formulary or list of covered drugs, or move a prescription drug to a different cost-sharing tier, during a plan year.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PROPERTY AND CASUALTY INSURANCE AND DISCRIMINATION AGAINST VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE.
stmtPurp: To (1) prohibit property and casualty insurers from discriminating against an individual solely because the individual is a victim of domestic violence, and (2) provide that such discrimination constitutes a violation of the Connecticut Unfair Insurance Practices Act.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE INSURANCE COMMISSIONER TO STUDY THIRD-PARTY HEALTH INSURANCE AND MEDICARE MARKETING.
stmtPurp: To require the Insurance Commissioner to study the marketing practices of third parties that generate revenue from referral fees paid to such entities based on Medicare-related and health insurance leads generated in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MANDATED HEALTH INSURANCE BENEFIT REVIEW.
stmtPurp: To alter the manner in which the General Assembly enacts new mandated health insurance benefits.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INSURANCE DEPARTMENT'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING THE PUBLIC HEALTH FEE, THIRD PARTY PERFORMANCE OF THE DEPARTMENT'S EMPLOYEES' DUTIES, THE INSURANCE DATA SECURITY LAW AND ASSESSMENTS AGAINST DOMESTIC INSURANCE COMPANIES AND ENTITIES.
stmtPurp: To (1) modify reporting requirements, and impose a late filing fee and penalty, concerning the public health fee, (2) permit attorneys, actuaries, accountants and experts to perform certain duties currently performed by the Insurance Department's employees, (3) modify the Insurance Data Security Law, and (4) modify the payment schedule for assessments against domestic insurance companies and other domestic entities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE COST OF PRESCRIPTION DRUGS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Cap aggregate monthly cost-sharing for prescription drugs covered under certain individual and group health insurance policies; (2) cap the cost of generic drugs in this state; (3) require the Commissioner of Consumer Protection to submit a request to the federal Secretary of Health and Human Services to implement a Canadian prescription drug reimportation program in this state and, if the secretary approves such request, implement such program in this state; (4) require pharmaceutical manufacturers to send notice to the Insurance Commissioner regarding "pay-for-delay" agreements, and require health carriers and pharmacy benefits managers to reduce the cost of brand name prescription drugs that are the subject of such agreements; (5) establish a Critical Drug Shortage Review Board; and (6) limit the circumstances in which a health carrier may remove a prescription drug from a drug formulary or list of covered drugs, or move a prescription drug to a different cost-sharing tier, during a plan year.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING HOMEOWNERS INSURANCE POLICIES AND COVERAGE FOR THE PERIL OF COLLAPSE.
stmtPurp: To require homeowners insurance policies to provide coverage for the peril of collapse and mitigation undertaken to prevent all or part of the covered dwelling from falling down or caving in.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY THE USE OF BREED OF DOG AS AN UNDERWRITING FACTOR FOR HOMEOWNERS INSURANCE POLICIES.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study the use of breed of dog as an underwriting factor for homeowners insurance policies delivered, issued for delivery, renewed, amended or endorsed in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DONOR BREAST MILK AND HUMAN MILK PRODUCTS DERIVED FROM DONOR BREAST MILK.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Require certain group health insurance policies to provide coverage for pasteurized donor breast milk and human milk products derived from donor breast milk; (2) require the Commissioner of Public Health to establish a program to regulate the donation, processing and distribution of donor breast milk and human milk products derived from donor breast milk; and (3) require the Commissioner of Social Services, to the extent permissible under federal law, to provide Medicaid coverage for pasteurized donor breast milk and human milk products derived from donor breast milk.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CRUMBLING CONCRETE FOUNDATIONS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Extend the sunset date for Connecticut Foundation Solutions Indemnity Company, Inc.; and (2) require the Insurance Commissioner to study methods available to accelerate responses by insurers to claims under homeowners insurance policies for foundation deterioration due to the presence of pyrrhotite.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING COVERAGE FOR THE REMOVAL OF TREES FROM REAL PROPERTY.
stmtPurp: To provide that insurers that are licensed to write homeowners or commercial property insurance in this state may provide coverage for the removal of trees that fall onto covered real property due to a natural disaster.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING INSURANCE COMPANIES FROM USING CREDIT HISTORY AS A FACTOR IN UNDERWRITING OR RATING PRIVATE PASSENGER NONFLEET AUTOMOBILE INSURANCE POLICIES.
stmtPurp: To prohibit insurance companies from using an applicant's or insured's credit history as a factor in underwriting or rating private passenger nonfleet automobile insurance policies.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING HOME IMPROVEMENT CONTRACTORS AND SALESPERSONS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Modify both the permissible and required terms of home improvement contracts; (2) preclude home improvement contractors from engaging in certain conduct to induce owners to enter into home improvement contracts; (3) require home improvement contractors to notify the commissioner regarding changes in their business names, trade names and addresses; (4) require home improvement contractors to maintain insurance coverage; (5) expand the required content of the application for a certificate of registration as a home improvement contractor; and (6) modify the grounds on which the Commissioner of Consumer Protection may (A) reprimand or place a home improvement contractor or salesperson on probation, or (B) revoke, suspend, or refuse to issue or renew a certificate of registration as a home improvement contractor or salesperson.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING CERTAIN INSUREDS FROM THE INSURANCE PREMIUM TAX.
stmtPurp: To exempt certain insureds insured by an association captive insurance company from the insurance premium tax.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LICENSING REQUIREMENTS FOR REAL ESTATE BROKERS.
stmtPurp: To modify the preconditions to issuing a real estate broker's license in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF EDTPA AS PART OF EDUCATOR PREPARATION PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To cease implementation of edTPA in the state and require each educator preparation program to develop and implement its own preservice performance assessment.

billTitle: AN ACT PERMITTING A SCHOOL DISTRICT TO PAY TUITION FOR SENDING ITS ELEMENTARY AND MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS TO ANOTHER DISTRICT.
stmtPurp: To allow a board of education to pay tuition to another school district for sending its elementary and middle school students to such other school district.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INTEGRATION OF SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL LEARNING IN PROGRAMS OF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT FOR EDUCATORS IN CONNECTICUT.
stmtPurp: To integrate the principles and practices of social-emotional learning in the program of professional development for educators in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ALLOCATION OF SLOTS FOR STATE-FUNDED CHILD CARE CENTERS.
stmtPurp: To allow certain operators of a child care center to allocate up to thirty per cent of the spaces at such center to children who are members of families with incomes above seventy-five per cent of the state median income.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SCHOOL LITERACY.
stmtPurp: To expand the intensive reading instruction program to include grades four and five, and to establish the Center for Literacy Research and Reading Success within the Department of Education.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PUBLIC ENFORCEMENT ACTIONS AND FORCED ARBITRATION AGREEMENTS.
stmtPurp: To allow employees to sue employers on behalf of the state after having waived their personal rights to sue by signing forced arbitration agreements.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EMPLOYEE LEAVE FOR DISASTER RELIEF VOLUNTEER SERVICE.
stmtPurp: To allow employees to volunteer for disaster relief service with nonprofit organizations without loss of vacation time, sick leave or earned overtime accumulation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DISCLOSURE OF SALARY RANGE FOR A VACANT POSITION.
stmtPurp: To require employers to disclose salary ranges for vacant positions and to provide comparable pay for comparable work.

billTitle: AN ACT MAKING MINOR AND TECHNICAL CHANGES TO LABOR DEPARTMENT STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make minor and technical changes to Labor Department statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT ENSURING FAIR AND EQUAL PAY FOR EQUAL WORK.
stmtPurp: To ensure fair and equal pay for equal work.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE PENALTIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE ISSUANCE OF A STOP WORK ORDER.
stmtPurp: To increase penalties for violating a stop work order.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WORKERS' COMPENSATION BENEFITS FOR MEMBERS OF UNDERWATER SEARCH AND RESCUE TEAMS AND CANINE SEARCH AND RESCUE TEAMS.
stmtPurp: To provide workers' compensation coverage for members of underwater search and rescue teams and canine search and rescue teams.

billTitle: AN ACT CREATING A RESPECTFUL AND OPEN WORLD FOR NATURAL HAIR.
stmtPurp: To prohibit discrimination on the basis of ethnic hairstyles historically associated with race, by adopting what is commonly referred to as the CROWN Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING COLLATERAL CONSEQUENCES OF A CRIMINAL RECORD.
stmtPurp: To protect individuals from discrimination based on criminal history record information.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DUTY TO RETREAT IN A HOUSE OF RELIGIOUS WORSHIP.
stmtPurp: To eliminate the requirement that a person in a house of religious worship retreat before using deadly physical force to defend himself or herself or a third person.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PROPERTY THAT IS EXEMPT FROM A JUDGMENT CREDITOR.
stmtPurp: To increase the value of certain personal and real property that shall be exempt from a judgment creditor and to provide that the cash surrender value of life insurance policies shall also be exempt from a judgment creditor.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE IMPOSITION OF PENALTIES FOR REPEATED VIOLATIONS OF MUNICIPAL REGULATIONS OR ORDINANCES.
stmtPurp: To improve a municipality's code enforcement provisions and reduce the number of repeat offenders.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE JURY ADMINISTRATOR IN SUMMONING JURORS.
stmtPurp: To better ensure that the composition of a jury is reflective of the overall population within the judicial district.

billTitle: AN ACT PERMITTING THE COMMISSIONER OF CORRECTION TO ACCEPT SERVICE OF PROCESS ON BEHALF OF AN EMPLOYEE OF THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION.
stmtPurp: To permit the Commissioner of Correction to accept service of process on behalf of an employee of the department who is named as a defendant in a civil action in his or her individual capacity.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ADVANCED DEPOSIT WAGERING.
stmtPurp: To delete a provision on the date of transfer of the off-track betting system and repeal the provision governing advanced deposit wagering.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE MILITARY TRAINING EVALUATION CONDUCTED BY THE LABOR DEPARTMENT.
stmtPurp: To extend the time limit for veterans to apply to the Labor Department for a military training evaluation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE AND BYLAWS OF THE MILITIA UNITS AND THE MAXIMUM RETIREMENT AGE FOR MEMBERS SERVING AS MUSICIANS IN BANDS OF THE GOVERNOR'S FOOT GUARDS.
stmtPurp: To require the Governor to determine the structure of the militia units and authorize the Adjutant General to issue bylaws for the militia, and to increase the maximum retirement age for members serving as musicians in bands of the Governor's Foot Guards.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LICENSED OCCUPATIONS OF MILITARY SPOUSES.
stmtPurp: To permit the state to recognize current, out-of-state occupational licenses held by military spouses.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING VETERANS' INTERVIEWS FOR FILLING CERTAIN VACANCIES IN STATE AGENCIES.
stmtPurp: To require that all veterans listed on the candidate for original appointments list by the Commissioner of Administrative Services be granted an interview when filling original appointment vacancies within state agencies.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING VETERAN-OWNED MICRO BUSINESSES.
stmtPurp: To provide veteran-owned micro businesses with economic opportunities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A PROPERTY TAX EXEMPTION FOR GOLD STAR PARENTS AND SURVIVING SPOUSES.
stmtPurp: To require municipalities to provide a property tax exemption to eligible Gold Star parents and surviving spouses.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING RETALIATION OR DISCRIMINATION AGAINST AN EMPLOYEE WHO IS A VETERAN FOR EXCEEDING PAID SICK LEAVE.
stmtPurp: To protect employees who are veterans from retaliation or discrimination by their employers for exceeding the number of paid sick leave days.

billTitle: AN ACT EXCLUDING CERTAIN VETERANS' BENEFITS WHEN DETERMINING ELIGIBILITY FOR PUBLIC ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To exclude certain veterans' benefits from income when determining eligibility for public assistance programs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE SECRETARY OF THE STATE AND RANKED-CHOICE VOTING.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study the implementation of ranked-choice voting.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING QUALIFYING CONTRIBUTIONS UNDER THE CITIZENS' ELECTION PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To require that the State Elections Enforcement Commission return to a campaign treasurer any contribution that does not qualify toward receiving a grant under the Citizens' Election Program so that such treasurer may return such contribution to the contributor.

billTitle: AN ACT REVISING CERTAIN CAMPAIGN FINANCE STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To (1) implement federal court rulings regarding independent expenditure political committees and aggregate contribution limits for individuals, (2) establish disclosure requirement for independent expenditures attacking or supporting incumbents before they form committees, (3) specify that certain communications publicizing candidate debates are not deemed expenditures, (4) align campaign finance statement filing schedules for statewide and legislative office candidates, (5) specify the period for certain reporting of independent expenditures, and (6) specify the authority with which certain independent expenditure disclosure statements are to be filed.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE SUPERSEDENCE OF COLLECTIVE BARGAINING AGREEMENTS AND THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT.
stmtPurp: To provide that future collective bargaining agreements or arbitration agreements may not supersede the Freedom of Information Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ADOPTION OF ATLANTIC STANDARD TIME.
stmtPurp: To require the state to adopt Atlantic Standard time upon the enactment of legislation in Massachusetts, Rhode Island and New York adopting said time and federal approval of such change.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE NONDISCLOSURE OF RESIDENTIAL ADDRESSES OF ATTORNEY GENERAL EMPLOYEES.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act of the residential address of employees of the office of the Attorney General.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CERTAIN CHANGES TO CAMPAIGN FINANCE LAWS.
stmtPurp: To (1) provide exemptions for communications that clearly identify the Governor or President of the United States and for campaign training conducted by party committees, (2) permit the use of Citizens' Election Program grant funds to offset dependent care costs, (3) increase transparency with respect to moneys paid to campaign consultants, (4) increase disclosure of independent expenditures and prohibit such expenditures by foreign-influenced entities, (5) reveal persons behind political committees and contributors to such committees, (6) revise the manner in which the State Elections Enforcement Commission processes complaints, (7) require online platforms to disclose purchasers of political advertisements, (8) ensure the amount of funds in the Citizens' Election Fund is sufficient to provide grants to each qualified candidate committee under the Citizens' Election Program, (9) create bright lines between coordinated and independent spending, (10) permit members of the State Elections Enforcement Commission to serve more than two consecutive terms, and (11) permit gubernatorial candidates participating in the Citizens' Election Program to raise additional funds and qualify for supplemental grants.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE STATE PROPERTIES REVIEW BOARD.
stmtPurp: To expand the purview of the State Properties Review Board to include licensing agreements, the purchasing of agricultural development rights and contracts entered into by other state agencies and quasi-public agencies and to move the board to within the Legislative Department.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ELECTRONIC NOTICE OF SPECIAL MEETINGS UNDER THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT.
stmtPurp: To amend the Freedom of Information Act to permit written notice of special meetings to be given electronically.

billTitle: AN ACT REVISING TRAINING REQUIREMENTS OF THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION COMMISSION.
stmtPurp: To revise the training requirements of the Freedom of Information Commission to remove training on vaping and smoking in public buildings and provisions concerning the Public Records Administrator and to make minor conforming changes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING JURISDICTION OVER DISPUTES IN ELECTIONS FOR THE OFFICES OF STATE SENATOR AND STATE REPRESENTATIVE.
stmtPurp: To provide that certain aggrieved parties may bring complaints regarding elections for the offices of state senator and state representative to the Superior Court.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INDEPENDENT PRACTICE OF ADVANCED PRACTICE REGISTERED NURSES RELOCATING TO CONNECTICUT.
