stmtPurp: To allow advanced practice registered nurses to independently engage in the performance of advanced practice level nursing activities after collaboration with a physician licensed to practice medicine in this state or outside of this state for not less than three years and not less than two thousand hours.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RECRUITMENT OF PHYSICIANS TO THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To establish a loan forgiveness program for purposes of recruiting physicians to the state and expanding access to primary and behavioral health care services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING VARIOUS REVISIONS TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To implement the Department of Public Health's recommendations regarding various revisions to the public health statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CLEAN ENERGY INCENTIVES FOR MANUFACTURERS.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to study methods to incentivize manufacturers' use of clean energy.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING BUSINESSES RECEIVING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FROM THE DEPARTMENT OF ECONOMIC AND COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT TO MAKE GOOD FAITH EFFORTS TO EMPLOY PERSONS WITH AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDER OR INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.
stmtPurp: To require businesses receiving financial assistance from the Department of Economic and Community Development to make good faith efforts to employ persons with autism spectrum disorder or intellectual and developmental disabilities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AID IN DYING FOR TERMINALLY ILL PATIENTS.
stmtPurp: To provide aid in dying to terminally ill patients.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SURGICAL SMOKE IN THE OPERATING ROOM.
stmtPurp: To require hospitals and outpatient surgical facilities to adopt and implement a policy to prevent human exposure to surgical smoke through the use of a surgical smoke evacuation system.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A TRANSITION PLAN FOR PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL DISABILITY WHO ARE A RESIDENT OF A COMMUNITY-BASED RESIDENTIAL FACILITY OR PARTICIPANT IN A DAY CARE PROGRAM, DAY CAMP PROGRAM OR RECREATIONAL PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Developmental Services to develop a transition plan for persons with intellectual disability who are a resident of a community-based residential facility or a participant in a day care program, day camp program or recreational program.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING CERTAIN MORTGAGE LENDERS FROM CHARGING CERTAIN FEES TO BORROWERS AFTER RECEIVING A PAYMENT TO REINSTATE A MORTGAGE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit certain mortgage lenders from charging certain fees to borrowers after receiving a payment to reinstate a mortgage.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING MONEY TRANSMITTERS TO PROVIDE CONSUMERS WITH A MONEY TRANSMISSION FRAUD WARNING.
stmtPurp: To require money transmitters to provide consumers with a money transmission fraud warning prior to wiring money.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MORTGAGE FORBEARANCE FOR OWNERS OF HOMES WITH CRUMBLING FOUNDATIONS.
stmtPurp: To require certain residential mortgages to include a provision that permits mortgage forbearance if the home requires repairs related to the presence of pyrrhotite in the foundation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LIENS FOR UNPAID WAGES AND A REQUIREMENT THAT FISCAL INTERMEDIARIES MEET EMPLOYER TIMELY PAY OBLIGATIONS.
stmtPurp: To authorize the Labor Commissioner or an employee to seek to establish a lien against the property of an employer for unpaid wages; and to establish requirements relating to the payment of timely wages on fiscal intermediaries that provide payroll services to personal care attendants.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ISSUES RELATING TO DEBT COLLECTION.
stmtPurp: To (1) require financial institutions to leave the lesser of the account balance or one thousand dollars in a judgment debtor's account during a bank execution; (2) increase the amount of the threshold of the aggregate cash price of a repossessed motor vehicle or boat for purposes of the formula for calculating the prima facie fair market value of such motor vehicle or boat; (3) eliminate extension options and establish a firm ten-year statute of limitations for the enforcement of small claims judgments; and (4) clarify that credit card charges for the purchase of goods and services are not to be considered moneys loaned for purposes of post-judgment interest.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ISSUES RELATING TO MORTGAGES AND MECHANIC'S LIENS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Require a mortgagee to deliver the mortgage release to the town clerk and a certified copy of such release to the mortgagor; (2) require a mortgagee to accept a payment for mortgage releases from an attorney's IOLTA account; (3) require the acceptance of certain payments on mortgage loans issued by Connecticut banks and Connecticut credit unions on and after October 1, 2020; and (4) allow property owners to substitute bonds for mechanic's liens without seeking judicial intervention.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE BANKING COMMISSIONER TO ESTABLISH A FIRST-TIME HOMEBUYER SAVINGS ACCOUNT PROGRAM AND ESTABLISHING A TAX DEDUCTION FOR CONTRIBUTIONS TO FIRST-TIME HOMEBUYER SAVINGS ACCOUNTS.
stmtPurp: To require the Banking Commissioner to establish a first-time homebuyer savings account program and establish a tax deduction for contributions to first-time homebuyer savings accounts.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING COMPUTER CRIMES AGAINST FINANCIAL INSTITUTIONS AND THEIR CUSTOMERS.
stmtPurp: To make clear that computer crimes include attacks (1) that involve any computer, computer network or computer software that is owned, leased or licensed by a financial institution, and (2) targeted at the money, property or personal information of customers that is being held by a financial institution in connection with a loan or deposit account, or in a fiduciary, trust or custodial capacity.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING INDOOR AIR QUALITY IN SCHOOLS.
stmtPurp: To require local and regional boards of education to maintain healthy indoor air quality in their schools.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NONLETHAL ELECTRONIC DEFENSE WEAPONS.
stmtPurp: To remove the prohibition on possession of nonlethal electronic defense weapons.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CREATION OF A SPECIAL EDUCATION EXCESS COST COOPERATIVE.
stmtPurp: To establish a special education excess cost cooperative.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TREASURER'S RECOMMENDATIONS FOR THE INCLUSION OF FINANCIAL LITERACY IN THE PUBLIC SCHOOL CURRICULUM.
stmtPurp: To (1) include instruction of personal financial management in the public school curriculum and as part of the high school graduation requirements; (2) require the development of a course in personal financial management and a model curriculum for grades kindergarten to eight that includes personal financial management; and (3) establish a personal financial management pilot program.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE COMMISSIONER OF ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES FROM DELEGATING THE RESPONSIBILITY OF ADMINISTERING THE SCHOOL BUILDING PROJECTS GRANT PROGRAM TO THE SECRETARY OF THE OFFICE OF POLICY AND MANAGEMENT AND REQUIRING THE DEPARTMENT OF ADMINISTRATIVE SERVICES TO MAINTAIN A DATABASE OF INFORMATION RELATING TO SCHOOL BUILDING PROJECTS ON THE DEPARTMENT'S INTERNET WEB SITE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the Commissioner of Administrative Services from entering into a memorandum of understanding with the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management to delegate the responsibility of administering the school building projects grant program, and to require the Department of Administrative Services to maintain and update a database of information relating to school building projects on the department's Internet web site.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING SCHOOL DISTRICT POLICIES THAT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST STUDENTS BASED ON NATURAL HAIR AND HAIRSTYLES.
stmtPurp: To prohibit local and regional boards of education from adopting policies that discriminate against students based on natural hair and hairstyles.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY ISSUES RELATING TO BULLYING AND SEXUAL HARASSMENT IN SCHOOLS.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study issues relating to bullying and sexual harassment in schools.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A WORKING GROUP TO EXAMINE WAYS TO CONSOLIDATE OR ELIMINATE CERTAIN PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND IN-SERVICE TRAINING REQUIREMENTS FOR EDUCATORS.
stmtPurp: To establish a working group to examine ways to consolidate or eliminate unnecessary, obsolete or redundant professional development and in-service training requirements for educators.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING VARIOUS REVISIONS AND ADDITIONS TO THE EDUCATION STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make various revisions and additions to the education statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SERVICE ANIMALS.
stmtPurp: To align state law with federal law concerning service animals and raise public awareness as to the rights and responsibilities of persons with service animals, emotional support animals and therapy animals.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LONG-TERM CARE SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To study the efficacy of state programs providing long-term care services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PAYMENT PARITY UNDER THE MEDICAID PROGRAM FOR MIDWIVES AND PODIATRISTS.
stmtPurp: To establish payment parity under the Medicaid program for midwives and podiatrists.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF MEDICAID-FUNDED PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To study the efficacy of Medicaid-funded programs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE USE OF VIDEO CAMERAS IN THE ROOMS OF NONVERBAL NURSING HOME RESIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To allow nonverbal nursing home residents or their representatives to install electronic monitoring devices in their rooms, provided any roommates agree in writing to the use of such devices and liability for any breach of privacy related to the resident's use of such device is waived for nursing homes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NONEMERGENCY MEDICAL TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAID BENEFICIARIES.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Social Services to consider recommendations made by the state Auditors of Public Accounts in negotiating any contract for nonemergency medical transportation and reduce administrative burdens on beneficiaries who need such transportation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MEDICAID COVERAGE OF IN-HOME COUNSELING AND SUPPORT PROVIDED BY A HOME HEALTH CARE AGENCY.
stmtPurp: To provide Medicaid reimbursement for in-home counseling, assessment and support services provided to a Medicaid recipient by a social worker employed by a home health care agency.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TECHNICAL AND CLARIFYING REVISIONS TO THE HUMAN SERVICES STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make technical and clarifying changes to statutes concerning human services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A RISK PROTECTION ORDER OR WARRANT.
stmtPurp: To establish a risk protection order and to expand upon the list of persons who may be complainants for purposes of issuance of a risk warrant; to require the Judicial Branch to develop and make available a form and explanatory materials (1) to persons applying for a risk protection order; (2) to disqualify persons subject to a standing risk protection order from possessing firearms or ammunition; and (3) to penalize any such possession.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING EXPANSION OF THE CRISIS INITIATIVE PILOT PROGRAM THROUGHOUT THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To require the Division of State Police to expand the CRISIS Initiative Pilot Program to all areas of the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EMERGENCY INTERVENTION BY A POLICE OFFICER WHEN A PERSON SUFFERS AN OPIOID OVERDOSE.
stmtPurp: To allow a police officer to detain and transport to the hospital a person who is suffering from a narcotic overdose and needs immediate care and treatment.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SMALL HOT WATER HEATERS.
stmtPurp: To exempt small hot water heaters from the provisions of chapter 540 of the general statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING COMMISSIONING OF POLICE OFFICERS AT INDEPENDENT INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION.
stmtPurp: To allow the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection to commission police officers at independent institutions of higher education.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE SANDY HOOK WORKERS ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AND FUND.
stmtPurp: To (1) eliminate time restrictions on requests for assistance from the Sandy Hook Workers Assistance program, (2) seek to recover funds from a charitable trust or entity currently operating the program, (3) require additional reports to the General Assembly on the fund's operation, and (4) provide a mechanism for future transfers of the fund to a charitable trust or entity.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION'S VEGETATION MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To examine the scope, need and effects of the Department of Transportation's vegetation management program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISION OF CERTAIN HUNTING AND FISHING RELATED STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To revise certain fishing and hunting related statutes concerning motor vehicle deer strikes, bow and arrow hunting, the use of night vision devices and veteran fishing events.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EXEMPTIONS TO THE PASSPORT TO THE PARKS FEE FOR SENIORS, VETERANS AND CERTAIN VEHICLE OWNERS.
stmtPurp: To exempt senior citizens and veterans from the Passport to the Parks vehicle registration fee and to apply such vehicle registration fee to only one vehicle when a person registers more than one vehicle with the Commissioner of Motor Vehicles.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FREE BOW AND ARROW PERMITS FOR SENIOR CITIZENS.
stmtPurp: To provide senior citizens with free bow and arrow permits to hunt deer and small game.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TOURISM ACCOUNT SURCHARGE ON MOTOR VEHICLE RENTALS AND LEASES.
stmtPurp: To specify that a marketplace facilitator is a retailer subject to collection and remittance of the tourism account surcharge.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LISTS OF DELINQUENT TAXPAYERS.
stmtPurp: To exclude persons making tax payments under a payment plan from the lists of delinquent taxpayers prepared by the Commissioner of Revenue Services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INTERSTATE COMPACT TO PHASE OUT CORPORATE GIVEAWAYS.
stmtPurp: To adopt the interstate compact to phase out corporate giveaways.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SCHOOL BUILDING PROJECT GRANTS FOR INCLUSIVE MUNICIPALITIES.
stmtPurp: To provide that school building project grants for inclusive municipalities be increased by ten percentage points.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF STATE REVENUE POLICIES.
stmtPurp: To require the Secretary of the Office of Policy and Management, in consultation with the Commissioner of Revenue Services, to conduct a study of the revenue policies of the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' RECOMMENDATIONS FOR MINOR AND TECHNICAL REVISIONS TO THE TAX AND RELATED STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make minor and technical revisions to the tax and related statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TAX TREATMENT OF TOBACCO PRODUCTS THAT ARE EXPORTED FROM THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To specify that tobacco products owned by a distributor, that are located on the premises of a warehouse in the state and exported from the state, are not subject to the tobacco products tax at the time the tobacco products are manufactured, purchased, imported, received or acquired in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE APPLICABILITY OF THE FILM PRODUCTION TAX CREDIT.
stmtPurp: To allow the film production tax credit to be claimed against the sales tax under certain circumstances and at a reduced rate.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF STATE FINANCE POLICIES.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioners of Economic and Community Development and Revenue Services to study the finance policies of this state and surrounding states.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A CREDIT AGAINST THE PERSONAL INCOME TAX FOR ADOPTION EXPENSES.
stmtPurp: To establish a credit against the personal income tax for adoption expenses.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE AGGREGATE AMOUNT OF TAX CREDITS FOR THE REHABILITATION OF HISTORIC STRUCTURES.
stmtPurp: To increase the aggregate amount of tax credits for the rehabilitation of historic structures.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ADMISSIONS TAX.
stmtPurp: To allow any event at the New Britain Stadium and the Xfinity Theatre in Hartford to be subject to the reduced admissions tax rate.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TOBACCO USE PREVENTION PROGRAMS FOR PERSONS UNDER TWENTY-ONE YEARS OF AGE.
stmtPurp: To provide additional state financial resources for the development of tobacco use prevention programs for persons under twenty-one years of age.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE REVISOR'S TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS TO THE GENERAL STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make various technical changes concerning grammar, clarity and accuracy of internal references and consistency in the general statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PROPERTY TAX EXEMPTIONS.
stmtPurp: To require assessors and boards of assessors to post certain property tax exemption statement forms on such assessors' and boards' Internet web sites, clarify that payments made by federal, state or local governments for the treatment, support or care of certain individuals shall not constitute housing subsidies for the purposes of determining what is a charitable purpose, require boards of assessors to consider whether certain property claimed to be exempt is owned or held in trust by federal tax-exempt charitable organizations, and clarify that subsidiary and affiliate entities of the Connecticut Institute for the Blind are tax exempt.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE GRANTING OF VARIANCES BY ZONING BOARDS OF APPEALS.
stmtPurp: To specify the conditions under which zoning boards of appeals may grant variances.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE USE OF LOCAL CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT FUND GRANTS FOR THE REMOVAL AND TRIMMING OF CERTAIN TREES.
stmtPurp: To authorize municipalities to use local capital improvement fund grants to remove and trim certain hazardous trees, limbs and branches.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MUNICIPAL RESTRICTIONS ON PET SHOPS.
stmtPurp: To clarify that a municipality may enact or enforce an ordinance to place certain obligations or restrictions on pet shops.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A STATE-WIDE GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEM TASK FORCE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study the need for and feasibility of establishing a centralized, state-wide geographic information system.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TAX ABATEMENT FOR CERTAIN CONSERVATION EASEMENTS.
stmtPurp: To authorize municipalities to abate real property taxes due on any portion of land that (1) meets the criteria for designation as a greenway, (2) is a terrestrial recreational trail that does not exceed one hundred feet in width, and (3) is the subject of a conservation easement conveyed by the owner of the land to a municipality, the state or a nonprofit land conservation organization.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A SPECIAL TAXING DISTRICT WITHIN THE CITY OF WEST HAVEN.
stmtPurp: To permit the establishment of a special taxing district in West Haven and authorize such district to make expenditures for public and private infrastructure improvements and issue bonds to finance the improvements.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING BLOOD SAFETY.
stmtPurp: To ensure the safe collection of blood and blood products.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DELIVERY OF HEALTHY HOME IMPROVEMENTS AND RETROFITS.
stmtPurp: To establish a pilot program for the delivery of home inspections, home improvements and retrofits to create healthier, more energy efficient homes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE USE OF FUNDS IN THE DRUG ASSETS FORFEITURE REVOLVING ACCOUNT.
stmtPurp: To make certain funds in the drug assets forfeiture revolving account available for the provision of inpatient drug treatment services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MEMORANDA OF UNDERSTANDING BETWEEN EXECUTIVE BRANCH AGENCIES.
stmtPurp: To require that a copy of any executed memorandum of understanding between two or more executive branch agencies be submitted to the relevant joint standing committees of the General Assembly.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE STATE BUDGET PROCESS.
stmtPurp: To require a study of the state budget process.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PERFORMANCE-INFORMED BUDGET REVIEW.
stmtPurp: To update the performance-informed budget review process of state agencies.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE CONNECTICUT SENTENCING COMMISSION WITH RESPECT TO MISDEMEANOR SENTENCES.
stmtPurp: To enact the Connecticut Sentencing Commission's recommendations with respect to misdemeanor offenses.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE POLICY AND PLANNING DIVISION AND THE PUBLICATION OF REPORTS AND PRESENTATIONS BY THE OFFICE OF POLICY AND MANAGEMENT.
stmtPurp: To maximize the contributions of the Criminal Justice Policy and Planning Division to criminal justice policy, research and grant administration, and to repeal or amend outdated or obsolete statutes that no longer accurately reflect priorities of criminal justice stakeholders.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE OFFICE OF HEALTH STRATEGY'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING VARIOUS REVISIONS TO HOSPITAL OR HEALTH SYSTEM FACILITY FEES.
stmtPurp: To make various revisions to hospital or health system facility fees.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PHYSICIAN ASSISTANTS' SCOPE OF PRACTICE.
stmtPurp: To make various revisions to the general statutes concerning physician assistants' scope of practice.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A REGULATORY SANDBOX PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To establish a regulatory sandbox program, which allows a person to temporarily test an innovative product or service on a limited basis without otherwise being licensed or authorized to act by the laws of this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT TAX CREDITS.
stmtPurp: To (1) allow businesses to utilize accumulated credits against the tax imposed under chapter 208 and chapter 219 of the general statutes in exchange for human capital investment, and (2) require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to conduct a study relating to research and development tax credits.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REQUIREMENTS APPLICABLE TO NOTARY PUBLICS, THE ISSUANCE OF TRADE NAME CERTIFICATES AND IMPROVED PUBLIC ACCESS TO BUSINESS RECORDS FILED WITH THE SECRETARY OF THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Revise statutory requirements applicable to notary publics, (2) establish a process for the issuance of trade name certificates, and (3) improve public access to business records filed with the Secretary of the State.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE COST OF TELECOMMUNICATIONS SERVICES IN CORRECTIONAL FACILITIES.
stmtPurp: To provide cost-free telecommunications for incarcerated persons.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PROMPT PRESENTATION OF CLAIMS AGAINST A DECEDENT'S ESTATE.
stmtPurp: To reduce the time period for a creditor to make a claim against the estate of a decedent.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CRIME VICTIMS' RIGHTS.
stmtPurp: To ensure crime victims are permitted to attend and participate in violation of probation or conditional discharge hearings and to provide crime victims access to information about the arrest and conviction of a defendant in the case of identity theft when the defendant participates in accelerated rehabilitation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE MATERIALS INNOVATION AND RECYCLING AUTHORITY'S SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL CONTRACTS.
stmtPurp: To provide certain requirements for the approval of municipal solid waste management contracts by the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE SMALL MUNICIPAL SEPARATE STORM SEWER SYSTEMS GENERAL PERMIT.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to provide certain assistance to municipalities in relation to compliance with the small municipal separate storm sewer systems general permit.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MINOR REVISIONS TO ENVIRONMENT-RELATED STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make various minor revisions to environmental programs including wastewater treatment facility operator certification programs, pesticide control programs and noise ordinance programs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A PILOT PROGRAM FOR LARGE-SCALE  BENEFICIAL REUSE OF CERTAIN SOIL PROJECTS.
stmtPurp: To provide a pilot program for the beneficial reuse of certain soils and materials.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING GREEN BURIALS.
stmtPurp: To require recommendations concerning the award of open space grants for properties used for green burial purposes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE USE OF GLYPHOSATE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the use of glyphosate in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING OPIOIDS.
stmtPurp: To combat the opioid epidemic in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING HUMAN TRAFFICKING AND SEXUAL MISCONDUCT AGAINST MINORS.
stmtPurp: To (1) increase the membership in the Trafficking in Persons Council, (2) allow certain testimony in the case of a delinquency proceeding to be compelled, (3) establish an affirmative defense for trafficking in persons in the case of a victim of trafficking, (4) redefine "sex trafficking", (5) change the required frequency of a refresher course in human trafficking awareness for certain professions, (6) extend vacatur relief to a person who committed certain crimes if a conviction is based on participation in the crime by the convicted person due to such person being a victim of trafficking, (7) to prohibit hourly rates at lodgings and require lodgings to establish a customer's identification before offering accommodation to such person, and (8) authorize extended periods of probation following convictions for certain crimes against minors.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING IMMUNITY FROM CRIMINAL PROSECUTION FOR A MINOR WHO POSSESSES ALCOHOL WHEN THE MINOR SEEKS EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE TO PREVENT THE DEATH OR SERIOUS INJURY OF ANOTHER PERSON.
stmtPurp: To provide immunity from criminal prosecution for a minor who possesses alcohol when the minor seeks emergency assistance to prevent the death or serious injury of another person.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING STATE REGISTRATION OF ENTITIES THAT PROVIDE COURT REPORTING SERVICES AND THE LICENSURE OF COURT REPORTERS.
stmtPurp: To require entities that provide court reporting services to register with the Department of Consumer Protection and to require court reporters to be licensed by the Department of Consumer Protection.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A PLAN TO LEVERAGE PRIVATE CAPITAL TO FUND SOLAR ENERGY PROJECTS IN THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to (1) identify five proposed solar energy projects in the state, (2) solicit proposals from property owners and municipalities to become the locations for such solar energy projects, and (3) develop a plan to expedite the permitting, grid connectivity and approval process for such solar energy projects.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE STATE'S ELECTRONIC BUSINESS PORTAL.
stmtPurp: To require the state's electronic business portal to (1) allow a business entity to create a single online account through which it may register with any state agency or quasi-public agency, apply for and renew licenses and permits and pay any fees, and (2) allow a state agency or quasi-public agency to communicate with a business entity regarding the status of any business registration, license, permit or application and maintain a database for managing business registrations, licenses and permits.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CASH BAIL.
stmtPurp: To provide that a cash bail with a deposit in an amount that is ten per cent of the amount of the bond shall be offered only after an order of the court and shall not be authorized automatically.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REPEAT JUVENILE OFFENDERS AND CONCERNING EARNED RISK REDUCTION CREDITS.
stmtPurp: To require automatic transfer to the regular criminal docket of a juvenile when the juvenile has at least four prior adjudications or convictions for a felony offense, to prohibit persons convicted of family violence crimes from earning risk reduction credits and to require inmates to adhere to their offender accountability plans and actively participate in eligible programming in order to earn risk reduction credits.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PUBLIC SAFETY COMMITTEES IN MUNICIPALITIES WHERE A CORRECTIONAL FACILITY IS LOCATED AND THE PROTECTION OF PERSONAL DATA RELATING TO AN EMPLOYEE OF THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION.
stmtPurp: To (1) revise the duties and composition of public safety committees in municipalities where a correctional facility is located, and (2) provide added protections for employees of the Department of Correction relating to the disclosure of personal data.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SEWER ASSESSMENT APPEALS.
stmtPurp: To make a technical change.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AN ANALYSIS OF MUNICIPAL CYBERSECURITY.
stmtPurp: To require that the Commissioner of Emergency Services and Public Protection analyze municipal cybersecurity needs throughout the state and determine the feasibility of the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection providing individualized assistance to municipalities most at risk of suffering cybersecurity attacks.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A TASK FORCE TO EXAMINE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A STATE-WIDE TAX ASSESSMENT APPEALS BOARD.
stmtPurp: To create a task force to examine the establishment of a state-wide tax assessment appeals board.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE WESTPORT LIBRARY ASSOCIATION.
stmtPurp: To amend the charter of the Westport Library Association.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE REASSESSMENT OF RESIDENTIAL BUILDINGS.
stmtPurp: To make a technical change.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SHARED MUNICIPAL SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To make a technical change.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CONSERVATION AND DEVELOPMENT.
stmtPurp: To make technical changes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REGIONAL PLANNING AND COUNCILS OF GOVERNMENTS.
stmtPurp: To (1) make certain modifications to the administration of the regional planning incentive account and related programs, and (2) revise the bylaws requirements for officers and conduct of regional councils of governments.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING AND ADJUSTING BONDS OF THE STATE FOR CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER PURPOSES, AND CONCERNING MUNICIPAL REPORTS ON CERTAIN PROPERTY TAX EXEMPTIONS, VALIDATION OF A REFERENDUM AND HIGHWAY PROJECTS.
AN ACT CONCERNING SECONDHAND DEALERS, PRECIOUS METALS OR STONE DEALERS AND THE SALE AND DISPOSITION OF PRECIOUS METALS AND STONES.
stmtPurp: To (1) remove the sunset date relating to methods of payment that secondhand dealers and precious metals or stones dealers may use when paying for property received, and (2) require dealers of precious metals and stones to retain certain property for ten days prior to the sale or disposition of such property.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CONFIDENTIALITY OF THE RESIDENTIAL ADDRESS OF CERTAIN PROTECTED PERSONS IN ONLINE MUNICIPAL RECORDS.
stmtPurp: To require municipalities to redact the residential address of program participants from any online version of municipal records.

billTitle: AN ACT REVISING CERTAIN STATUTES REGARDING VOTER REGISTRATION AND ELECTION ADMINISTRATION.
stmtPurp: To revise or repeal certain election administration laws concerning (1) admission of electors and maintenance of registry lists, (2) training of certain election officials, (3) residential status of tabulator tenders, and (4) delivery of election returns to the Secretary of the State, town clerks and registrars of voters.

billTitle: AN ACT IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE AUDITORS OF PUBLIC ACCOUNTS.
stmtPurp: To implement the recommendations of the Auditors of Public Accounts contained in their 2019 annual report.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ETHICS.
stmtPurp: To make technical changes to a provision concerning ethics.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ORGANIZATIONAL REVISIONS TO ELECTION DAY REGISTRATION PROCEDURES.
stmtPurp: To permit towns to provide additional locations for election day registration and require that registrars of voters advise the Secretary of the State of expected staffing levels at election day registration locations.

billTitle: AN ACT PROTECTING CHILD PORNOGRAPHY VICTIMS.
stmtPurp: To replace the term "child pornography" with "child sexual exploitation material" throughout the general statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REGISTRARS OF VOTERS.
stmtPurp: To make technical changes to provisions concerning registrars of voters.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TECHNICAL CHANGES TO ELECTION LAWS.
stmtPurp: To make technical changes to provisions concerning elections.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO ELECTION LAWS.
stmtPurp: To (1) provide an additional circumstance under which a no-contest election of town committee members may occur, (2) specify dates certain after which new enrollees in a party may not be used in computing the number of signatures required on nominating petitions, (3) increase the signature threshold on primary petitions for candidates for state legislative offices, and (4) make technical and conforming changes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO THE CITIZENS' ELECTION PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To make technical revisions to provisions concerning the Citizens' Election Program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TOWN CLERKS.
stmtPurp: To make technical changes to provisions concerning town clerks.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO STATUTES RELATING TO THE EXECUTION OF A POWER OF ATTORNEY, THE UNIFORM TRUST CODE, THE TAKING OF AN OATH BY AN ARBITRATOR AND  INTERESTS IN REAL PROPERTY.
stmtPurp: To make revisions to statutes relating to: (1) The execution of a power of attorney, (2) the Uniform Trust Code, (3) the taking of an oath by an arbitrator, and (4) interests in real property.

AN ACT CONCERNING DIABETES AND HIGH DEDUCTIBLE HEALTH PLANS.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Expand required health insurance coverage for prescription drugs, equipment and supplies used to treat diabetes; (2) restrict cost-sharing for such drugs, equipment and supplies; (3) require licensed pharmacists to dispense such drugs, equipment and supplies without a prescription in certain circumstances; (4) require the Commissioner of Social Services to study and report regarding the feasibility of implementing a low-income diabetes assistance fund; and (5) make changes to various provisions of the general statutes concerning high deductible health plans to more closely conform to provisions of the Internal Revenue Code concerning health savings accounts and medical savings accounts.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE PERSONAL NEEDS ALLOWANCE FOR CERTAIN LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY RESIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To allow long-term care facility residents who receive medical assistance to keep more of their income for personal needs.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING ACCESS TO THE CONNECTICUT HOME-CARE PROGRAM FOR THE ELDERLY.
stmtPurp: To avert costly, unnecessary institutionalization of elderly persons by expanding access to the Connecticut home-care program for the elderly.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING ACCESS TO THE ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE RESPITE CARE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To allow more persons to receive services through the Alzheimer's disease respite care program.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING ACCESS TO THE ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE RESPITE CARE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To expand access to services for persons with Alzheimer's disease and their caregivers.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING NURSING HOME RATES OF PAYMENT.
stmtPurp: To increase rates of Medicaid reimbursement for nursing homes to ensure a sufficient number remain open to provide care for elderly persons and others in need of such care.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE PERSONAL NEEDS ALLOWANCE FOR CERTAIN LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY RESIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To allow long-term care facility residents who receive medical assistance to keep more of their income for personal needs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE REVERSAL OF NURSING HOME RATE REDUCTIONS.
stmtPurp: To reduce the threat of nursing home closures due to rate reductions and avert the adverse impact on elderly residents in need of care in nursing homes.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE PERSONAL NEEDS ALLOWANCE FOR CERTAIN LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY RESIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To allow long-term care facility residents who receive medical assistance to keep more of their income for personal needs.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING THE PERSONAL NEEDS ALLOWANCE FOR CERTAIN LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY RESIDENTS.
stmtPurp: To increase the amount long-term care facility residents can keep for personal needs while still qualifying for medical assistance.

billTitle: AN ACT REPEALING THE PROHIBITION AGAINST RIDICULE OF ANOTHER PERSON ON ACCOUNT OF CREED, RELIGION, COLOR, DENOMINATION, NATIONALITY OR RACE.
stmtPurp: To repeal section 53-37 of the general statutes concerning ridicule of another person on account of creed, religion, color, denomination, nationality or race.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING FEMALE GENITAL MUTILATION.
stmtPurp: To establish the crime of mutilation of female genitalia of minors as a class D felony.

billTitle: AN ACT PERMITTING PERSONS SIXTEEN YEARS OLD TO DONATE BLOOD.
stmtPurp: To permit persons sixteen years old to donate blood.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING THE SALE OF FLAVORED CIGARETTES, TOBACCO PRODUCTS, ELECTRONIC NICOTINE DELIVERY SYSTEMS AND VAPOR PRODUCTS.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the sale of flavored cigarettes, tobacco products, electronic nicotine delivery systems and vapor products.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FOOD ALLERGY INFORMATION IN RESTAURANTS.
stmtPurp: To require the display of food allergy information in the kitchen and designated staff area of restaurants.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING THE CLEAN INDOOR AIR ACT.
stmtPurp: To implement the Department of Public Health's recommendations regarding the Clean Indoor Air Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MEDICAL MARIJUANA FOR VETERANS.
stmtPurp: To exempt veterans from the fees for registration and written certification for medical marijuana and to establish a process to identify veterans who qualify as patients for medical marijuana.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING ALL ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE MEMBERS FROM FEES FOR OPERATOR LICENSES OR REGISTRATIONS.
stmtPurp: To exempt active duty service members who were not residents of Connecticut at the time of induction from fees for motor vehicle operator's licenses or registrations.

billTitle: AN ACT PERMITTING THE COMMUNITY SPOUSE OF AN INSTITUTIONALIZED MEDICAID RECIPIENT TO RETAIN THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF ALLOWABLE ASSETS.
stmtPurp: To reduce the financial burden on spouses of nursing home residents whose care is being funded under the Medicaid program.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO REVIEW VOLUNTARISM NEEDS OF THE STATE OMBUDSMAN.
stmtPurp: To study ways to increase the number of volunteers to assist the State Ombudsman's Office and expand services to community-based residents.

billTitle: AN ACT REDUCING PARTICIPANT COSTS AND EXPANDING ELIGIBILITY FOR THE CONNECTICUT HOME-CARE PROGRAM FOR THE ELDERLY.
stmtPurp: To reduce costs and expand eligibility for the Connecticut home-care program for the elderly.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RETROACTIVE MEDICAID ELIGIBILITY FOR HOME CARE SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To allow Medicaid beneficiaries who are receiving home care the same right to retroactive Medicaid coverage as beneficiaries who are in nursing homes.

billTitle: AN ACT DETERRING AGE DISCRIMINATION IN EMPLOYMENT APPLICATIONS.
stmtPurp: To prevent the use of initial employment applications to discriminate against potential employees based on age.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A REVOLVING LOAN FUND TO ASSIST ELDERLY HOMEOWNERS.
stmtPurp: To provide assistance to elderly homeowners who have fallen behind on real estate tax payments.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ELIGIBILITY FOR THE OFFICE OF EARLY CHILDHOOD'S CHILD CARE SUBSIDY PROGRAM FOR VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE.
stmtPurp: To allow a victim of domestic violence to access the child care subsidy program established by the Office of Early Childhood.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHILDREN'S MENUS.
stmtPurp: To require restaurants to include certain beverages on children's menus and in children's meals.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SCHOOL LUNCH DEBT.
stmtPurp: To prohibit disciplinary action against public school children for unpaid school lunch charges and to allow any public or private parties to donate to payoff such debt.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHILDREN'S PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Children and Families to conduct a study to evaluate the efficacy of the programs administered by the Department of Children and Families.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A PROGRAM TO PROVIDE FREE SWIMMING LESSONS TO INDIVIDUALS UNDER THE AGE OF EIGHTEEN.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection to establish and administer a program to provide free swimming lessons to individuals under the age of eighteen.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHILDREN'S SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Children and Families to conduct a study to determine whether policy and procedural changes in the Department of Children and Families may increase the effectiveness of services provided to children.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MINOR CHANGES TO THE STATUTES OF THE DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES.
stmtPurp: To make minor revisions to the statutes of the Department of Children and Families and to consolidate the reporting requirements of the department.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A FUND TO PROVIDE CERTAIN TRIBAL SERVICES AND PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To provide services and maintain tribal lands under the control of the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CONNECTICUT'S SHELLFISH RESTORATION PROGRAM AND THE CONNECTICUT SEAFOOD ADVISORY COUNCIL.
stmtPurp: To enhance the state's shellfish restoration program through certain contracting authority and to reconstitute the Connecticut Seafood Council.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE TAX ASSESSMENT OF CERTAIN AQUACULTURE PROPERTIES.
stmtPurp: To authorize the application of the Public Act 490 tax program to aquaculture operations.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TRAINING STANDARDS FOR ROAD SALT APPLICATORS.
stmtPurp: To help mitigate the effects of sodium chloride contamination of private wells and public drinking water supplies.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DRAW DOWN SCHEDULE ON LAKE BESECK.
stmtPurp: To provide for a longer six foot draw down period of Lake Beseck in odd-numbered years in order to increase the likelihood of root exposure for aquatic plants to temperatures that assist in the effective management of such plants.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE USE AND DISTRIBUTION OF POLYSTYRENE PRODUCTS.
stmtPurp: To decrease the use of certain polystyrene products in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING BONDS OF THE STATE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE NAUGATUCK VALLEY RAILROAD HUB.
stmtPurp: To authorize bonds of the state for the development of the Naugatuck Valley Railroad Hub.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING BONDS OF THE STATE FOR CONSTRUCTION OF A REGIONAL SENIOR CENTER IN GRISWOLD.
stmtPurp: To authorize bonds of the state for construction of a regional senior center in Griswold.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEARN HERE, LIVE HERE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Economic and Community Development to implement the Learn Here, Live Here Program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION.
stmtPurp: To require the Office of Higher Education to conduct a study regarding post-secondary education in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING FINANCIAL TRANSPARENCY OF THE STUDENTS FIRST PLAN.
stmtPurp: To require the Board of Regents for Higher Education to provide a detailed financial report of the Students First plan.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A RIGHT TO HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To establish a right to housing for all residents of the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY ON MUNICIPAL WORKFORCE HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Housing to conduct a study concerning methods to increase housing options for municipal employees.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE CONCERNING VARIOUS ISSUES AT HOMELESS SHELTERS.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to make recommendations on how to address various issues at homeless shelters.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING THE OPEN CHOICE VOUCHERS PILOT PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To establish a pilot program to enable certain families participating in the interdistrict public school attendance program to move to the town where their children attend school.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A LANDLORD'S ABILITY TO CONSIDER THE CRIMINAL RECORD OF PROSPECTIVE TENANTS.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Housing to adopt regulations concerning a limited time period for which a landlord may consider the criminal record of a prospective tenant.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING HOUSING AUTHORITY JURISDICTION.
stmtPurp: To allow a housing authority to expand its jurisdiction to include certain high and very high opportunity areas, as determined by the Department of Housing.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' RECOMMENDATIONS FOR TECHNICAL REVISIONS TO STATUTES CONCERNING PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT.
stmtPurp: To make technical revisions to statutes concerning planning and development.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DISCLOSURE OF DAMS AND SIMILAR STRUCTURES BY SELLERS OF REAL PROPERTY.
stmtPurp: To require the seller of real property on which a dam or similar structure is located to disclose the existence of such dam or similar structure on a residential condition report.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ACCESS TO ORIGINAL BIRTH CERTIFICATES BY ADULT ADOPTED PERSONS.
stmtPurp: To grant access to original birth records to all adopted persons eighteen years of age or older who were born in Connecticut regardless of date of birth.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ALTERNATE MEMBERS OF MUNICIPAL PLANNING COMMISSIONS.
stmtPurp: To permit members of municipal zoning commissions and municipal boards of appeals to serve as alternate members of municipal planning commissions.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A MUNICIPAL OPTION TO ESTABLISH A PROPERTY TAX CREDIT FOR DONATIONS TO CERTAIN SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To permit a municipality to provide a property tax credit to any owner of property in such municipality that donates to a scholarship program established by such municipality.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING DISABLED VETERANS FROM THE "PASSPORT TO THE PARKS FEE" WHEN REGISTERING A MOTOR VEHICLE.
stmtPurp: To exempt any person who is a disabled veteran from the "Passport to the Parks Fee" when registering a motor vehicle.

billTitle: AN ACT REDUCING THE SUBSIDY FOR CTFASTRAK.
stmtPurp: To reduce the subsidy for CTfastrak.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FEES RECEIVED BY THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES FOR COMMEMORATIVE LICENSE PLATES.
stmtPurp: To require that the fee paid for a commemorative license plate be used for the purpose for which the license plate was created and not be deposited into the General Fund.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE USE OF CLEAN AIR ACT FEE FUNDS FOR CERTAIN BROWNFIELD REMEDIATION PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To require that Clean Air Act fee funds be used to fund brownfield remediation programs administered by municipalities.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING SENIOR CITIZENS AND VETERANS FROM PAYING THE PASSPORT TO THE PARKS MOTOR VEHICLE REGISTRATION FEE.
stmtPurp: To exempt senior citizens and veterans from having to pay the Passport to the Parks motor vehicle registration fee.

billTitle: AN ACT LIMITING PASSPORT TO THE PARKS MOTOR VEHICLE REGISTRATION FEES FOR A PERSON REGISTERING MORE THAN ONE VEHICLE.
stmtPurp: To limit the Passport to the Parks motor vehicle registration fee to just one vehicle if a person registers more than one vehicle.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING FUNDING FOR REGIONAL FIRE TRAINING SCHOOLS.
stmtPurp: To increase funding for the operation of the regional fire training schools.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING APPROPRIATIONS FOR COMMUNITY NONPROFIT PROVIDERS.
stmtPurp: To begin catch-up payments to community nonprofit providers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT FOR LEGISLATORS.
stmtPurp: To reduce costs to the state by ensuring that legislators are reimbursed only for the mileage that they have driven.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DEPARTMENT OF CONSUMER PROTECTION LICENSING AND ENFORCEMENT.
stmtPurp: To make minor and technical changes to streamline the Department of Consumer Protection's licensing and enforcement statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT FUNDING THE STATE-WIDE FIREARMS TRAFFICKING TASK FORCE BY REDUCING CITIZENS' ELECTION PROGRAM GRANTS.
stmtPurp: To provide funding to the state-wide firearms trafficking task force.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PROTECTION OF FUNDING FOR PUBLIC INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION.
stmtPurp: To provide adequate funding and support to Connecticut's public institutions of higher education in order to ensure their future growth and success.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FREE COMMUNITY COLLEGE.
stmtPurp: To provide tuition-free community college for Connecticut residents.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION TO DIRECT BUDGETARY RESOURCES TO LITCHFIELD COUNTY FOR THE PURPOSE OF INCREASING THE AVAILABILITY OF MASS TRANSIT OPTIONS.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Transportation to use existing budgetary resources to increase the availability of mass transit options to residents of Litchfield County.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FUNDING FOR SUICIDE PREVENTION ORGANIZATIONS.
stmtPurp: To provide funding for suicide prevention organizations.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A CONNECTICUT INDUSTRIAL HISTORY TRAIL.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Economic and Community Development to establish a Connecticut industrial history trail.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STATE ECOTOURISM MAP.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Economic and Community Development, in consultation with the Departments of Energy and Environmental Protection and Agriculture, to develop and maintain on its Internet web site a "Live Here, Love Here" interactive ecotourism map to identify and promote the agricultural, recreational and other physical and natural resources of this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REGIONAL TOURISM DISTRICTS.
stmtPurp: To require each regional tourism district to return unexpended tourism funding to the Department of Economic and Community Development for the purpose of supporting state-wide marketing and to eliminate the requirement that the central regional district office be located within the department.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CONSUMER PRIVACY.
stmtPurp: To require businesses to disclose the proposed use of any personal information and to give consumers the right to discover what personal information the business possesses and to opt out of the sale of such information and to create a cause of action and penalties for violations of such requirements.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REVISIONS TO PHARMACY AND DRUG CONTROL STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make revisions to Department of Consumer Protection pharmacy and drug control statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MOTOR VEHICLE OWNER AND SMALL BUSINESS RIGHT TO REPAIR.
stmtPurp: To protect the rights of motor vehicle owners and small businesses regarding the repair of motor vehicles.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DATA PRIVACY BREACHES.
stmtPurp: To expand the data privacy breach notification statute to protect consumers.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING MANUFACTURERS OF BRAND NAME PRESCRIPTION DRUGS TO PROVIDE SAMPLES OF SUCH DRUGS TO MANUFACTURERS OF GENERIC PRESCRIPTION DRUGS.
stmtPurp: To promote competition in the prescription drug market by allowing developers of generic drugs and biosimilar products to obtain reference samples.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHANGES TO CONSUMER PROTECTION STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To amend consumer protection statutes concerning health clubs and the automobile lemon law.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING FREE FEMININE HYGIENE PRODUCTS IN MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT BATHROOMS.
stmtPurp: To require local and regional boards of education to provide free feminine hygiene products in middle and high school student bathrooms.

billTitle: AN ACT DESIGNATING THE DEPARTMENT OF MENTAL HEALTH AND ADDICTION SERVICES A SINGLE HEALTH CARE ENTITY.
stmtPurp: To allow the Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services to use one electronic health record system that all clinical staff can use for documentation across all Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services clinics and hospitals.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING VITAL RECORDS SEARCH FEES.
stmtPurp: To allow the Department of Public Health to charge vital records search fees.

billTitle: AN ACT PROHIBITING COVENANTS NOT TO COMPETE INVOLVING PHYSICIANS.
stmtPurp: To prohibit covenants not to compete involving physicians.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DECEPTIVE ADVERTISING PRACTICES OF LIMITED SERVICES PREGNANCY CENTERS.
stmtPurp: To prohibit deceptive advertising practices by limited services pregnancy centers.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING PHARMACIES TO MAKE MANUFACTURER REBATES FOR PRESCRIPTION DRUGS AVAILABLE TO PATIENTS.
stmtPurp: To require pharmacies to make manufacturers' rebates for prescription drugs available to patients.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' OFFICE'S RECOMMENDATIONS  REGARDING REVISIONS TO THE PUBLIC HEALTH STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make minor and technical revisions to the public health statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WHITING FORENSIC HOSPITAL.
stmtPurp: To allow patients in the maximum security building at Whiting Forensic Hospital to be present during routine searches of personal belongings and to add two members to the hospital's advisory board.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE USE OF HELMETS BY MOTORCYCLE OPERATORS AND PASSENGERS UNDER TWENTY-ONE YEARS OF AGE.
stmtPurp: To require the use of helmets by motorcycle operators and passengers under twenty-one years of age.

billTitle: AN ACT REVISING A MOTOR VEHICLE STATUTE.
stmtPurp: To make a technical change to a motor vehicle statute.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INSTALLATION OF CAMERA VIDEO SYSTEMS INSIDE SCHOOL BUSES AND STUDENT TRANSPORTATION VEHICLES USED TO TRANSPORT STUDENTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND THE MAXIMUM SPEED SCHOOL BUSES MAY TRAVEL ON A DIVIDED LIMITED ACCESS HIGHWAY.
stmtPurp: To study (1) issues related to the installation of camera video systems inside school buses and student transportation vehicles used to transport students with special needs, and (2) whether to increase the maximum speed a school bus may travel on a divided limited access highway.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RECOMMENDATIONS BY THE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION.
stmtPurp: To implement the recommendations of the Department of Transportation and make other changes to the transportation statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE NONEMERGENCY TRANSPORTATION OF PERSONS WHO ARE ELDERLY AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES CONFINED TO A STRETCHER.
stmtPurp: To allow temporary and permanent livery permit holders to transport in a stretcher van certain elderly persons and persons with disabilities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AN ADVANCED OPERATOR'S RETRAINING PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To establish an advanced operator's retraining program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE MARKING OF VEHICLE COMPONENT PARTS WITH THE COMPLETE VEHICLE IDENTIFICATION NUMBER OF SUCH VEHICLE.
stmtPurp: To specify that the marking of a vehicle component part shall (1) include certain characteristics and information, and (2) be maintained in a secured database by the dealer, lessor or company performing the marking.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING RAIL INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Transportation to study rail infrastructure issues and recommend rail infrastructure improvements.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE FOR POST-SECONDARY EDUCATION EXPENSES FOR YOUTH ADOPTED THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES FOSTER CARE PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To expand the policy for financial assistance for post-secondary education expenses to youths adopted on or after January 1, 2001, through the Department of Children and Families foster care program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PROVISION OF FREE FEMININE HYGIENE PRODUCTS IN MIDDLE AND HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT BATHROOMS.
stmtPurp: To require local and regional boards of education to provide free feminine hygiene products in middle and high school student bathrooms.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE ALBERT J. SOLNIT CHILDREN'S CENTER.
stmtPurp: To require the Albert J. Solnit Children's Center - South Campus to obtain licensure from the Department of Public Health.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE PLACEMENT OF CHILDREN COMMITTED TO THE CUSTODY OF THE COMMISSIONER OF CHILDREN AND FAMILIES.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Children and Families to give priority to grandparents in the placement of children committed to the care of the commissioner.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SMOKING IN NURSING HOMES, ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES AND OTHER HOUSING FOR THE ELDERLY.
stmtPurp: To protect the health of elderly residents by ensuring that smoking is not allowed in nursing home facilities and state or federally subsidized housing designated for elderly persons.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING FUNDING FOR AGING IN PLACE INITIATIVES.
stmtPurp: To appropriate a sufficient amount of funds to expand aging in place initiatives.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING SENIOR CENTERS.
stmtPurp: To (1) include senior center staff members among persons municipalities can name as municipal agents for the elderly, (2) authorize the establishment of multipurpose senior centers, (3) authorize additional resources for senior centers, and (4) establish a working group to study the needs of senior centers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING LONG-TERM CARE SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To study the efficacy of state programs providing long-term care services.

billTitle: AN ACT LOWERING THE AGE OF ELIGIBILITY FOR PROPERTY TAX RELIEF FOR SENIOR CITIZENS.
stmtPurp: To increase the number of elderly residents who may be eligible for property tax relief and allow municipalities to exempt from taxation one motor vehicle belonging to a person age seventy-one or older who has resided in the municipality not less than forty years.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DRY CLEANING ESTABLISHMENT REMEDIATION GRANTS.
stmtPurp: To make various revisions to the eligibility requirements and application procedures for dry cleaning establishment remediation grants.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE BIOSCIENCE INDUSTRY.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to study issues relating to the state's bioscience industry.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TAX CREDIT FOR BUSINESSES THAT HIRE FORMERLY INCARCERATED INDIVIDUALS.
stmtPurp: To establish a tax credit for businesses that hire formerly incarcerated individuals.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING MANUFACTURER NEEDS IN THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to study the needs of manufacturers in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CONNECTICUT INNOVATIONS, INCORPORATED AND PRIVATE EQUITY INVESTMENT.
stmtPurp: To require Connecticut Innovations, Incorporated to study private equity investment in the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ISSUES AFFECTING THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Economic and Community Development to conduct a study of economic development issues affecting the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE LEGISLATIVE COMMISSIONERS' RECOMMENDATIONS FOR TECHNICAL REVISIONS TO THE EDUCATION AND EARLY CHILDHOOD STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To make technical revisions to the education and early childhood statutes.

billTitle: AN ACT IMPLEMENTING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE DEPARTMENT OF EDUCATION.
stmtPurp: To implement the recommendations of the Department of Education.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEVELOPMENT OF A FRAMEWORK FOR ASSESSING THE PROVISION OF PUBLIC EDUCATION IN CONNECTICUT.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Education to develop a framework for evaluating the effectiveness of school district programs and policies that are intended to address disparities in academic achievement among racial and socio-economic lines.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING EDUCATION ISSUES.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Education to study education issues.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ELECTRICITY SHUTOFF NOTIFICATIONS.
stmtPurp: To (1) broaden the notice requirements prior to termination of utility service to include electronic mail, text message, and phone calls, (2) require gas and electric distribution companies to report the aggregate number of utility service terminations, disconnections and reconnections, and (3) require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to examine the termination practices of the gas and electric distribution companies and report to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to energy.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ESTABLISHMENT OF A FEE PAID BY MULTICHANNEL VIDEO PROGRAMMING DISTRIBUTORS TO COMPANIES OR ORGANIZATIONS RESPONSIBLE FOR COMMUNITY ACCESS PROGRAMMING.
stmtPurp: To (1) define "subscriber" and "video streaming", (2) require the Public Utilities Regulatory Authority to establish a fee paid by subscribers of video streaming, Internet access and cable television, and (3) limit the applicable fee to one household per purchased service.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ENERGY CONSUMPTION DATA AND LABELING.
stmtPurp: To require (1) nonresidential property owners of buildings greater than or equal to fifty thousand gross square feet, or two or more buildings on the same parcel that are greater than or equal to one hundred thousand gross square feet, report the previous calendar year's energy consumption data to the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection, and (2) residential property owners to disclose, upon request at the time the property is publicly listed for sale or rent, the previous calendar year's energy bills.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ENERGY EFFICIENCY STANDARDS.
stmtPurp: To establish and update state appliance and equipment energy and water efficiency standards.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CONNECTICUT GREEN BANK.
stmtPurp: To enable the Connecticut Green Bank to be considered as a potential borrower of funds from the United States Department of Agriculture and to fix technical changes concerning the appointed term length of a board of directors member.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CALL BEFORE YOU DIG PROGRAM VIOLATIONS.
stmtPurp: To require that civil penalties for the failure of a public utility to properly or timely mark the approximate location of an underground facility be paid by the person, public agency or public utility to whom the notice of failure to comply is addressed.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING THE STUDY OF ENERGY SOURCES.
stmtPurp: To require the Commissioner of Energy and Environmental Protection to conduct a study to determine whether policy and procedural changes within the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection may increase the effectiveness of energy sources utilized by the state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING NEW HOME CONSTRUCTION CONTRACTORS AND HOME IMPROVEMENT CONTRACTORS.
stmtPurp: To protect consumers by effectively regulating new home construction contractors and home improvement contractors.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE COST OF 2-1-1 FOR LIFELINE PROGRAM CELLULAR TELEPHONE CUSTOMERS.
stmtPurp: To require any provider of lifeline cellular telephone service to not charge any minutes for calls to 2-1-1 and to require the state reimburse the provider for such cost.

billTitle: AN ACT INCREASING OPPORTUNITIES FOR WORKFORCE HOUSING DEVELOPMENT IN THE STATE.
stmtPurp: To establish the workforce housing development program in opportunity zones and to create additional opportunities for workforce housing development in other parts of the state using tax credits, fee waivers and property tax abatement.

billTitle: AN ACT EXCLUDING CERTAIN FACILITIES FROM THE DEFINITION OF COMMUNITY RESIDENCES FOR ZONING PURPOSES.
stmtPurp: To define community residence to exclude commercial medical facilities or facilities requiring a certificate of need.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PAYMENTS IN LIEU OF TAXES TO MUNICIPALITIES FOR HOUSING AUTHORITIES.
stmtPurp: To provide municipalities in which a housing authority is located with payments in lieu of taxes.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY OF APPRENTICE AND OTHER WORKFORCE HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Housing to conduct a study of methods to increase options for apprentices and other newly hired employees to reside in the municipality where they are employed.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING THE HEALTHY HOUSING ASSISTANCE PILOT PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To establish a pilot program to provide rental assistance certificates to assist families who have children with persistent asthma to move to healthier environments.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING FIRST RESPONDER AFFORDABLE HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To permit municipalities to establish first responder affordable housing for active members of a volunteer fire department or volunteer ambulance service.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING HOUSING.
stmtPurp: To make technical changes to a statute concerning housing.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CHANGES TO THE HUSKY B PROGRAM.
stmtPurp: To cap copayments to the HUSKY B health program and repeal a program offering intensive services that are offered under a related program.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A LIST OF THE ONE HUNDRED MOST DELINQUENT CHILD SUPPORT OBLIGORS.
stmtPurp: To end the publication of the names of delinquent child support obligors.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING METHADONE MAINTENANCE.
stmtPurp: To set a new time table for development of performance measures for methadone maintenance providers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING OBSOLETE REFERENCES RELATING TO THE DEPARTMENT OF SOCIAL SERVICES IN THE GENERAL STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To revise certain provisions in the general statutes containing obsolete references to the Department of Social Services.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CONNECTICUT HOME-CARE PROGRAM FOR PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES.
stmtPurp: To clarify that persons eligible to receive Medicaid-funded services are not eligible to receive services under the Connecticut home-care program for persons with disabilities.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE STATE-WIDE HEALTH INFORMATION EXCHANGE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
stmtPurp: To add a representative of the Department of Social Services to the State-wide Health Information Exchange board of directors.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR CERTAIN EPINEPHRINE CARTRIDGE INJECTORS.
stmtPurp: To prohibit certain health insurers from denying, or making any distinction or discrimination in, coverage for an epinephrine cartridge injector administered to an insured by a third party who provided or administered the injector to the insured to provide an emergency first aid response for an allergic reaction, regardless of whether the insured held a valid prescription for such injector.

billTitle: AN ACT EXTENDING THE PREMIUM BILLING NOTICE PERIOD FOR RENEWAL OF CERTAIN PERSONAL AND COMMERCIAL RISK INSURANCE POLICIES.
stmtPurp: To extend the premium billing notice period for renewal of certain personal and commercial risk insurance policies.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING REQUIRED HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR LOW PROTEIN MODIFIED FOOD PRODUCTS, AMINO ACID MODIFIED PREPARATIONS AND SPECIALIZED FORMULAS.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for specialized formulas for individuals twelve years of age and older.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE INSURANCE COMMISSIONER TO ADOPT REGULATIONS ESTABLISHING CONTINUING EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS FOR PUBLIC ADJUSTERS.
stmtPurp: To authorize the Insurance Commissioner to adopt regulations establishing continuing education requirements for public adjusters.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY HEALTH INSURANCE AND HEALTH CARE INEQUITY IN THIS STATE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study health insurance and health care inequity in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A TASK FORCE TO STUDY THE SMALL GROUP HEALTH INSURANCE MARKET IN THIS STATE.
stmtPurp: To establish a task force to study the small group health insurance market in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR MOTORIZED WHEELCHAIRS.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for motorized wheelchairs, including, but not limited to, used motorized wheelchairs, repairs to motorized wheelchairs and replacement batteries for motorized wheelchairs.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR CERTAIN SURGICAL PROCEDURES PERFORMED TO TREAT SEVERE OBESITY.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for certain surgical procedures performed to treat severe obesity.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING TRAVEL INSURANCE AND SUICIDE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit insurance companies that issue travel insurance policies in this state from excluding coverage because the insured or the insured's spouse, child, dependent relative who resides in the insured's household or traveling companion commits suicide.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING CERTAIN HEALTH INSURERS TO OFFER AND SELL A QUALIFIED HEALTH PLAN THROUGH THE CONNECTICUT HEALTH INSURANCE EXCHANGE.
stmtPurp: To require certain health insurers that deliver, issue for delivery, renew, amend or continue certain group health insurance policies in this state to offer and sell through the Connecticut Health Insurance Exchange at least one qualified health plan providing coverage to qualified employers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INSURANCE DEPARTMENT'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING SURETY BAIL BOND AGENTS.
stmtPurp: To (1) restrict how frequently the Insurance Commissioner may examine a surety bail bond agent's books and records, (2) automatically cancel a surety bail bond agent's license if the agent does not pay an annual examination fee, (3) reschedule an annual transfer to the General Fund from the surety bail bond agent examination account, and (4) authorize the commissioner to adopt regulations concerning continuing education requirements for surety bail bond agents.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INSURANCE DEPARTMENT'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING GENETIC TESTING.
stmtPurp: To: (1) Restrict the manner in which certain insurers may use, and obtain the results of, genetic testing; and (2) provide that certain uses of genetic testing shall constitute a violation of the Connecticut Unfair Insurance Practices Act.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH CARE SHARING MINISTRIES TO COMPLY WITH THE PATIENT PROTECTION AND AFFORDABLE CARE ACT.
stmtPurp: To require health care sharing ministries to comply with the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE INSURANCE DEPARTMENT'S RECOMMENDATIONS REGARDING HOMEOWNERS INSURANCE, CREDIT LIFE INSURANCE, CREDIT ACCIDENT AND HEALTH INSURANCE AND INSURANCE PRODUCERS.
stmtPurp: To (1) specify the manner in which certain insurers must cancel certain homeowners insurance policies, (2) require the Insurance Commissioner to disapprove certain credit life insurance and credit accident and health insurance forms if the loss ratios contained in such forms do not satisfy certain criteria, and (3) reduce the total number of hours of study that an applicant for an insurance producer license must successfully complete for each line of insurance for which such applicant is seeking such license.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DUTIES OF THE OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL.
stmtPurp: To clarify the Attorney General's authority to (1) investigate allegations that an individual's civil rights are being violated, and (2) initiate legal proceedings in response to such allegations.

billTitle: AN ACT AUTHORIZING A CASINO GAMING FACILITY IN BRIDGEPORT, SPORTS WAGERING, ENTERTAINMENT ZONES, ONLINE GAMING, ONLINE LOTTERY TICKET SALES AND ONLINE KENO.
stmtPurp: To authorize a casino gaming facility in Bridgeport, sports wagering, entertainment zones, online gaming, online lottery ticket sales and online keno.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CT2030 AND CONNECTICUT INFRASTRUCTURE.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Transportation to develop an infrastructure improvement plan.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A TASK FORCE REPORT ON FULLY AUTONOMOUS VEHICLES.
stmtPurp: To extend the date by which a task force shall submit a report to the joint standing committee of the General Assembly having cognizance of matters relating to transportation.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE CONNECTICUT PORT AUTHORITY.
stmtPurp: To make a minor change to a statute concerning the Connecticut Port Authority.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A STUDY BY THE DEPARTMENT OF MOTOR VEHICLES OF PEER-TO-PEER CAR-SHARING SERVICES.
stmtPurp: To require the Department of Motor Vehicles to study peer-to-peer car-sharing services.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING HEALTH INSURANCE COVERAGE FOR EQUINE THERAPY FOR VETERANS.
stmtPurp: To require health insurance coverage for equine therapy for veterans.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ELIGIBILITY FOR CERTAIN VETERANS' BENEFITS.
stmtPurp: To include initial active duty for training purposes to be counted as qualifying service for veterans' benefits eligibility for operators' licenses, veteran designation on license plates and college credit for military training.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AN APPROPRIATION FOR THE CONNECTICUT WING CIVIL AIR PATROL.
stmtPurp: To appropriate three hundred forty-one thousand dollars to the Department of Emergency Services and Public Protection for a grant to the Connecticut Wing Civil Air Patrol.

billTitle: AN ACT EXPANDING CERTAIN VETERANS' ELIGIBILITY FOR PUBLIC ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS.
stmtPurp: To exclude all veterans' pension benefits from income when determining eligibility for public assistance programs.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A MILITARY PERMIT FOR THE SALE OF ALCOHOLIC LIQUOR.
stmtPurp: To expand the military permit under the Liquor Control Act to the sale of alcoholic liquor.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A LAW ENFORCEMENT SUPPORT OFFICE PROGRAM ACCOUNT.
stmtPurp: To establish a law enforcement support office program account.

billTitle: AN ACT EXEMPTING ALL ACTIVE DUTY SERVICE MEMBERS FROM FEES FOR MOTOR VEHICLE OPERATOR'S LICENSES OR REGISTRATIONS.
stmtPurp: To exempt active duty service members who were not residents of Connecticut at the time of induction from fees for motor vehicle operator's licenses or registrations.

billTitle: AN ACT REQUIRING A STUDY OF VETERANS' TAX ABATEMENTS.
stmtPurp: To study tax abatements available to veterans in this state.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING PER DIEM EQUITY FOR STATE BOARD OF MEDIATION AND ARBITRATION ARBITRATORS.
stmtPurp: To ensure per diem compensation equity for State Board of Mediation and Arbitration arbitrators.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING BASIC LABOR STANDARDS FOR TRANSPORTATION NETWORK COMPANY DRIVERS.
stmtPurp: To provide basic labor standards for transportation network company drivers.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A FAIR WORK WEEK SCHEDULE.
stmtPurp: To prohibit the practice of on-call shift scheduling.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE RIGHT OF A PUBLIC EMPLOYEE TO JOIN OR SUPPORT A UNION.
stmtPurp: To protect the rights of public employees to join or support unions.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WORKERS' RIGHTS.
stmtPurp: To require the Labor Commissioner to adopt regulations regarding workers' rights.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING THE DEPARTMENT OF LABOR.
stmtPurp: To require the Labor Commissioner to adopt regulations regarding the efficient operation of the Labor Department.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING WORKERS' COMPENSATION BENEFITS FOR CERTAIN MENTAL OR EMOTIONAL IMPAIRMENTS SUFFERED BY EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES PERSONNEL, DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTION EMPLOYEES AND DISPATCHERS.
stmtPurp: To extend workers' compensation benefits for certain mental or emotional impairments to emergency medical services personnel, Department of Correction employees and dispatchers.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING COLLECTIVE BARGAINING RIGHTS FOR CERTAIN AGRICULTURAL WORKERS.
stmtPurp: To authorize certain agricultural workers to engage in collective bargaining.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ELECTIONS.
stmtPurp: To (1) require registrars of voters to certify certain information regarding designated locations for election day registration, permit the Secretary to order any changes deemed necessary for the effective conduct of election day registration and eliminate the requirement to perform a cross-check before admitting an applicant for election day registration, (2) permit applicants in line for election day registration prior to eight o'clock p.m. to be admitted as electors and cast a vote in a regular election, (3) restore, without the payment of certain fines, the electoral privileges of convicted felons who are on parole, (4) establish processes at certain state agencies for eligible individuals to automatically apply for voter registration, and (5) require the Secretary of the State to develop a system through which election-related forms can be signed electronically.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING VOTER PRIVACY PROTECTION.
stmtPurp: To limit the availability of voter registration information to certain purposes and prohibit certain other uses of such information.

billTitle: AN ACT ESTABLISHING A CYBERSECURITY TASK FORCE.
stmtPurp: To establish a cybersecurity task force.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING ACCESS TO DIAPER CHANGING STATIONS IN PUBLIC AND COMMERCIAL BUILDINGS.
stmtPurp: To amend the State Building Code to require diaper changing tables that are accessible to women and men in all newly constructed or substantially renovated public or commercial buildings that include at least one restroom open to the public.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING CONFLICTS OF INTEREST DUE TO AN EMPLOYER OTHER THAN THE STATE UNDER THE STATE CODE OF ETHICS.
stmtPurp: To apply substantial conflict of interest provisions in the state code of ethics for public officials and state employees to conflicts involving the public official's or state employee's nonstate employer or spouse's employer.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING A DISPARITY STUDY.
stmtPurp: To require the Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities and Institute for Municipal and Regional Policy to conduct a disparity study.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING AUDITING OF SIGNED STATEMENTS OF ELECTORS PRIOR TO VOTING.
stmtPurp: To require certain election officials to (1) maintain information about electors who sign statements in lieu of presenting certain identification at the polls when voting in person, and (2) compile a report of such information for submission to the Secretary of the State.

billTitle: AN ACT CONCERNING DEADLINES FOR MAILINGS IN ANY PROVISION OF THE GENERAL STATUTES.
stmtPurp: To provide that the postmark date of mailing shall be valid for any statutory deadline.
